ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
ResponsesInList.Text: The new version of the Deft response block (1.3) has been released with a new integration with Jitsi Meet project. The block allows meeting elements to be added to a course or activity. Block content can be changed remotely and users can use real time chat and polls. They can also meet with each other using audio and video. Previously it required a remote service for updating content and audio and video. Now you can install your own Jitsi Meet server to provide that functionality instead of using the remote media server. The older servive remains available for convenience.

ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel The documentation says, "If you wish to use Jitsi Meet, you need to install and configure a Jitsi Meet server locally." Does it mean, we can't connect it to a third party Jitsi server?

ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
ResponsesInList.Text: It should work with external hosting as long as it is set up of token based authentication and you have an app ID and secret for the Moodle instance. You can use the same App id and secret with the Jitsi activity if you are using that (or Plenary meeting ).

ResponsesInList.Title: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Looking to have a discussion around pros and cons of continuing to use the plugin vs moving to LTI integration. The plugin looks to be still well supported. Anyone have any thoughts on this? Plugin vs LTI

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: As the current plugin developer, we are maintaining it because it gives additional benefits beyond what the LTI can offer by more closely integrating with Moodle's core functionality. Whether you are pre-assigning breakout rooms using Moodle groups, automatically collecting participation reports, auto-linking to Zoom recordings, or scheduling Webinars instead of Meetings, we include functionality that real people need and not just what Zoom has decided to offer. Plus, if there's functionality that you need, you are in control of your destiny. A lot of organizations will suggest functionality and sometimes provide the code to accomplish it. Those conversation's happen on our GitHub repository.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jonathan, is there anywhere I can find out more about the grading and attendance reporting of Zoom sessions within a course? I'm trying to advise on which way to integrate with Zoom, but it's hard to find information on the detailed functioning of either option. many thanks in advance

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Isabel, Sorry for the delay - we currently have two options for grading and attendance reporting. However, due to limitations in Zoom itself, any method has some level of inaccuracy. For a detailed discussion of the development process for the newer duration-based grading: https://github.com/ncstate-delta/moodle-mod_zoom/pull/477 In summary, one method is "attendance grading", so that when the student clicks to join the meeting from Moodle they get full credit for attending the meeting. The newer duration-based method gives percentage credit based on the duration of attendance. The newer method is complicated, because it relies heavily on the data that is available in Zoom and matching up the attendee information with the Moodle user information is not always exact, so manual editing may be needed in varying amounts depending on how the Zoom meetings and the Zoom plugin activities are configured. Here is the grading method help text: Choose the method to use when grading student participation. Upon entry: the student receives full marks (max grade) when they click to join the meeting in Moodle. Attendance duration: the student receives a score based on the percentage of their meeting attendance compared to the total meeting duration. Notes regarding Attendance duration method:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Susan, I've been searching for this exact question, so I was wondering how you got on? Did you implement one or the other?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Isabel, We have been successfully using the Zoom plug-in for a few years now and are happy with it. We are currently on moodle v4.1.

ResponsesInList.Title: Cannot delete Moodle courses with no longer existing BBB activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Community, We have used Big Blue Button a few years ago and it was used in some Moodle courses. Now the BBB server no longer exists. I get the following error message when I try to delete the Moodle course: Error: Argument 1 passed to mod_bigbluebuttonbn\instance::__construct() must be an instance of cm_info, null given, called in [ dirroot ]/mod/bigbluebuttonbn/classes/instance.php on line 139 Deleting the Moodle course is not possible. Does anyone have a solution for the problem? thanks & best regards Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: Cannot delete Moodle courses with no longer existing BBB activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Community, I think I have found a solution. Perhaps it will also work for others: I think that the BBB plugin accesses the BBB server when deleting the courses in order to delete the recording there as well. Our old server data is still stored in the Moodle backend (bigbluebuttonbn_server_url), but the server no longer exists. In my opinion, this causes the error message in Moodle and the course can therefore not be deleted. Our solution is as follows: we still have a server URL and the token of an old BBB test instance that is still running. We have entered this URL and token in the backend. Now the courses can also be deleted - even if the recordings do not exist on this test server. At least it works for us. best regards, Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Randomly disappearance of recordings sometimes in some courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again. I'm still waiting for BigBlueButton developer team to answer me. Could anyone help me? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Randomly disappearance of recordings sometimes in some courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Mohammad Reza Zamani, When the status is set to 1, this means the recording has been 'dismissed' i.e. for one reason or another, the recording could not be retrieved from the BBB server . This can happen for a number of reasons, but most likely is network connectivity issues of the user when the process of fetching recordings from the BBB server takes place. Currently a workaround for retrieving these disappearing recordings exists, which is to run CLI script found in the plugin directory at mod/bigbluebuttonbn/cli/update_dismissed_recordings.php on the Moodle server. It will change the status and process the recordings so that they show up in Moodle again. Hopefully this helps, Shamiso Jaravaza

ResponsesInList.Title: recurring bbb meeting
ResponsesInList.Text: how can i make the bbb meeting repeated every week

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: recurring bbb meeting
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi ahmed alwa, BBB meetings work more like rooms which are open until the teacher schedules them to be closed than instances that repeat at set times. So to answer your question, there is no straightforward way to do it. There are workarounds that might work for you, depending on what you want to accomplish e.g. one BBB activity that has an open and closing time that is edited every week

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: recurring bbb meeting
ResponsesInList.Text: An idea, works only if the teacher has an account on the BBB server , not going through the Moodle BBB plug-in . - Visit bbbserver/rooms and reate a new "room" on the BBB server and start it. You'll get a link like bbbserver/rooms/xxx-xxx-xx-xxx/join and an access code. - On Moodle create a URL resource for that link. You can put the access code in its description. - Use the availability options Moodle offers to limit the access to what you want. Of course if you give the access code in the description, the student can go there any time - and meet others! You have to judge whether that is OK with your audience. Otherwise, there must be ways of rotating the access code, etc.

ResponsesInList.Title: Column missing in table:  recordings_deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: I recently upgraded Moodle from 4.1 to 4.2 and that seems to have gone well.  I am new to this server , which I inherited and am learning as I go. I noticed that in the Performance Overview, there is an error for Database schema check.  Further investigation shows that for bigbluebuttonbn (I am assuming that this is the table) that column 'recordings_deleted' is missing. I cloned my VM and then in the clone, uninstalled and then reinstalled the BigBlueButton plugin.  The schema error disappeared in the Performance Overview.  Comparing the differences in the table bigbluebuttonbn on the production database vs. my clone shows that column 'recordings_deleted' has been added to the table.  It seems that all the other column schemas are the same. running the command show create table mdl_bigbluebuttonbn; shows the following column in my clone vm and is missing in production: `recordings_deleted` tinyint(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT '1', Am I safe to insert this column into the the production server database table, inserting it in the same column order as on my cloned database?  I intend to use the following command:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Column missing in table:  recordings_deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Steve Brisco, My guess would be that this is related to this issue https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-74555 (long story short, recordings_deleted was removed in BBB plugin v3.0 but not yet in the core BBB plugin). That is likely why when you uninstalled the plugin then reinstalled it in your VM, there was no longer an error.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Column missing in table:  recordings_deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Shamiso Jaravaza for some possible backstory. The deed of inserting the missing column into the database schema was performed 3 weeks ago with no apparent issue.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Column missing in table:  recordings_deleted
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, I come here after seing, in some of my Moodle sites, using Moodle 4.0 for the moment, but upgraded lately to this version, the same problem when i check database schema. Other Moodle sites, upgraded sooner to 4.0 (and then 4.1) don't suffer this problem. If i understand well you explaination, it's because they didn't upgraded to non standard plugin v3.0 (thus deleting this column) before going to Moodle 4.0 ? In fact, when looking the details of this table, in Moodle 4.0 upgraded later (after using non standard 3.0 i think), i have theses columns : 
```text
lockonjoin
lockonjoinconfigurable
```
 And at the opposite, in Moodle 4.0 upgraded sooner , i have the following columns existing (not in Moodle upgraded later) : 
```text
recordings_deleted
```
 And, in Moodle version 4.0 upgraded sooner , and then using
4.1 , i have the following columns existing (not in Moodle upgraded later) : 
```text
recordings_deleted
guestallowed
mustapproveuser


guestlinkuid


guestpassword
```
 So, should i just ignore this, because this column will be deleted in later Moodle version ? Or should i add it, allowing for a proper deletion in the future ? What about the existing lock columns ? Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Column missing in table:  recordings_deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: The issue is essentially that this column does not exist only in v3.0. After an upgrade from this version, that column will trigger a missing error in the performance check. Any fresh install 4.0 onwards won't have this issue. The behavior of the columns you mentioned besides recording_deleted are all expected. This is supposed to happen as these are related to the improvements and deprecation of features across plugin versions. Nothing needs to be done on your end about them. If you could provide the specific Moodle versions you have made these observations on that would help confirm it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Moodle with external BigBlueButton service

Reading in it, there is this text: " Execute / Rexecute migration for recordings.Sometimes when the remote BigBlueButton server is temporarily not accessible and we upgrade to the new way of storing recordings some activities end up without recordings. This script will allow to go through each meeting and fetch all recordings that have not yet been fetched from the remote BigblueButton server ." Maybe it solve.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bigbluebutton maximum time and forced logout for all meetings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Antonello Pau, the scheduling in Moodle handles a user's ability to enter the room (between the start and end time) however once a user is in the room, they will not be kicked out because the end date and time has passed. There is the 'duration' parameter, primarily used for API calls, which sets the maximum length for a meeting. However there is no way to set this with the UI in Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: BigBlueButton: Moderator/Presenter audio choppy during webinar
ResponsesInList.Text: These are not Moodle problems, but BigBlueButton provider problems. You should contact your BBB provider or if you simply "Don't known who is"  probably you've not configured anything else than the "free server " preconfigured in Moodle 4.x, but the preconfigured one it's only a test server with limitations. If you plan to use BBB, you should subscribe a service (the fast and secure way) or install BBB by yourself on premise (the hard way). ...Zoom it's not a "no pay" choice, why BBB should ? WebConferencing systems consume power/network that has to be payed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response audio conference
ResponsesInList.Text: We just released a new version 1.1 Beta of the Deft response block that has support for audio conferencing. This plugin is designed to deeply integrate conferencing functions into Moodle. In this case a teacher can make a button appear in block in a course or activity that allows learners to talk to each other while they are engaged in the course activities with one click of the button. A demo is available at https://deftly.us . Following Audio conferencing link and log in with the test accounts on separate devices.

ResponsesInList.Title: BigBlueButton - Security Salt does not exist?
ResponsesInList.Text:
I am setting up BigBlueButton with the default free account and getting the muchtalked about "Unable to connect. Please check the url of the BigBlueButton server AND check to see if the BigBlueButton server is running" error. I was able to find the troubleshooting guide https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/error/bigbluebuttonbn/view_error_unable_join#Exceptions and am following the steps. Part 1 is fine as when I switch away from test-moodle and instead use test-install with the default secret, I am am able to launch the room just fine. For step two, the URL is fine as I am doing an exact copy/paste from the default (I tried both http and https just in case) When I get to step 3, everything goes off the rails. ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: BBB Recording Disappears in my Moodle Site
ResponsesInList.Text: Most probably, you didn't configure a self-hosted BBB server or a BBB service (for which you have to pay). The free service offered by Blindside Networks on their cloud, for me obviously, does not maintain recordings for more than a few days as it's there only for testing the functionality. Please read carefully here: https://docs.moodle.org/400/en/BigBlueButtonBN especially the chapter "Requirements": the default one is a test only installation, you should provide a BBB server/cloud service to get it running in the right way. in short, the response is no, and you could not request them to recover a deleted recording as there is no backup strategy in the test installation. HTH

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: BBB Recording Disappears in my Moodle Site
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, You can try API mate to see what's going on with recordings on your server. That would give a better idea of whether your problem is a Moodle plugin problem or a server problem. Outside of moodle, this is the only way to 'see' recordings I know of. Is that what you were referring to when you mentioned the recordings still exist on the server? You can try this: - In Moodle, create a test recording in the same activity where your missing recordings are. - Get recordingID from the recording link and use that recordingID in API mate to get the meetingID, getRecordings will give this info. - Use the meetingID to find recordings using getRecordings. If you can see details about your missing recordings, it's a Moodle plugin problem. If there are no recording details, it's definitely your configured server. Hope this helps!

For us, if the client is happy to keep paying for space, we keep recordings or agree with them when/frequency to get rid of old recordings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton Stats/reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi BBB is an activity in Moodle like any other. So in the logs for the user you'll find the events "Meeting joined" and "Meeting left". If you need it all in a central attendance register, you might want to consider the https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_attendance plug-in. I'm not a heavy user of BBB, so don't know the details. You might want to request the moderator to move this discussion to the Web conferencing plugins forum.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton Stats/reports
ResponsesInList.Text: I've just moved this thread to the Web conferencing plugins forum as suggested by Visvanath.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton Stats/reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi James, I know my answer is coming a little overdue here, but in case the question is still on the air. As it has been mentioned before, the Plugin captures all the activity that happens in Moodle. Users viewing the room/activity, joining the session, doing click on the recording, etc. Those events are logged as any other plugin in Moodle, which means any plugin or report you already use can give you that information. Now, in regards to what happens in the live session, that is a different history, because that information is recorded by BigBlueButton itself and right now there is no way to pass it back to Moodle. There is a commercial solution out there that gives you a report with the activity in the session. It is called statistics and it is presented to the Teachers and Administrators as a recording format in the same way the Playback format is presented. But again that is only available if the BBB server offers that format. As far as I know, the only ones providing that format right now are the Blindside Networks folks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton: Recording table in plain HTML is missing in Moodle 4
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rainer Schaufelberger, As of Moodle 4.0 "UI as html is enabled by default" (bigbluebuttonbn_recordings_html_default) was removed. The reasoning behind it is that it would be simpler to use one UI than alternate between two (behaviour of the table would be different for each).

ResponsesInList.Title: BigBlueButton - Sudden Classroom Errors - Unable to Connect to BigBlueButton Server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I'm at my witts end here! After 18 months of successful running all of a sudden, 3 instances that I manage encountered the same error. All instances of Moodle are version 3.9 and BBB version 2.2. We suddenly received an error when trying to access the classroom link and/or recorded sessions. It stated "Unable to connect to the BigBlueButton Server ." I double checked the URL and secret in the plugin settings and they were all correct. A restart of both the moodle and BBB servers allowed us to start a session again, but now it will not load a presentation. It just won't show any slides and gives an error in the BBB logs about failed to upload presentation 404 error. I'm unsure if this is a moodle/BBB plugin error or a BBB server error, but any pointers would be greatly received as I've now spent 6 hours trying to solve and need to get this up and running before lessons resume tomorrow. Many Thanks Greg

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: BigBlueButton - Sudden Classroom Errors - Unable to Connect to BigBlueButton Server
ResponsesInList.Text: Are you using Let's Encrypt Certificates on BBB ? Take care of this if apply: https://twitter.com/letsencrypt/status/1443621997288767491

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton - Sudden Classroom Errors - Unable to Connect to BigBlueButton Server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Unfortunately, I also found this problem on September 30, and it seems to be related to the expiration of Let's Encrypt's certificates, and I did not find a solution for it because my web server is Windows. This is the only problem with Moodle's LMS and other systems such as WordPress do not have a problem

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton - Sudden Classroom Errors - Unable to Connect to BigBlueButton Server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, had the same problem on a Windows system. Solution: replace cacert.pem in moodle/lib with an updated version. Best, Frank

ResponsesInList.Title: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Everyone, Any help much appreciated. I am trying to connect my Moodle to my own BigBlueButton server . It worked for a day but now whenever I add an instance of BigBlueButton to the moodle I get the error Exception - Class 'plugin' not found - with a 404 error thrown on https://example.com/course/modedit.php?add=bigbluebuttonbn&type=&course=167&section=0&return=0&sr=0 I can connect to the demo server from Moodle using the default settings. I can connect to my own bigblueserver from another moodle running on localhost using the secret / salt from bbb-conf. If I run WGET from inside my Moodle container with the URL of my BBB server it return the SUCCESS code - <response> <returncode>SUCCESS</returncode> <version>2.0</version> My setup Big Blue Button: Version 2.4-rc-1 Moodle: Moodle 3.11.3+ (Build: 20211003) running in a docker container behind a proxy server. Moodle Big Blue Plugin: 2019101011 Any ideas how I could further troubleshoot the problem Thanks again

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: I have the same problem but I can't find any solution for it yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Can you share some more details of your system and then we can work out what is causing it. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Every thing was ok until 5 days ago. Suddenly the bigbluebuttonbn plugins stop working and we received an error that the moodle can not communicate with bigbluebutton server(Unable to join the meeting. Please check the url of the BigBlueButton server AND check to see if the BigBlueButton server is running.) while our other moodle site is working properly with the same bigbluebutton. We remove the plugins & install the last version so we receive the above error.(Exception - Class 'plugin' not found) Again we downgrade it to previous version again we couldn't access to our server.We change the Moodle server location & migrate it to other server but nothing change. we Upgrade the moodle to 3.11 the same problem exist. everything works properly separately but together there is this problem

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok so that was the same day that mine went down. So I'm guessing it's something to do with the Sept / Oct change. Maybe an expired SSL certificate. I've no idea to be honest. How are you managing SSL?

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: In Sept, 30 there was the Let's Encrypt CA expiration: search on google and you'll find many hints about this problem. Anyway, the exception it's not related to this, but it seems that you have one of these situations: PHP version not adequate to the moodle release you're using (most probable) BBB plugin version for a different moodle release or a development one (less probable) Check them with the official documentation for the moodle release last installed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi - thanks a lot for the response. The PHP version is fine - I'm running 7.3.0 with Moodle 3.11.3+ I also have the correct BBB plugin version Also the plugin was working fine before October 1st so I don't think the PHP version can be the problem. Can you think of any reason the Let's Encrypt CA expiration could have an effect. I can reach my BBB server OK from the Moodle container. My PHP instance is in a different container on the same network. I'm using this proxy server: https://github.com/nginx-proxy/nginx-proxy - to manage the moodle installation and other subdomains. From my PHP container: strace -e openat wget -O - https://examplebbserver.com/bigbluebutton/ returns ERROR: The certificate of 'examplebbbserver.com' has expired. Is this relevant at all? Thanks for your time

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes... Your PHP container does not own updated ca-certificates chains, so when your moodle PHP code tries to contact bbb's API, the https connection fails.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok - yep that did it. 1. I downloaded the PEM chain of the BBB server from Firefox -(clicking on the padlock > connection secure > more information > view certificate > download PEM chain 2. Copied the complete chain as .crt files to /usr/share/ca-certificates/ on the php container 3. Ran update-ca-certificates on the php container 4. Ran dpkg-reconfigure ca-certificates on the php container 5. Checked I could now connect to the BBB server from the PHP container using strace -e openat wget -O - https://examplebbserver.com/bigbluebutton/ 6. Got the success code 7. Checked on Moodle and everything is good. Thanks for the support

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Well done! What if some crazy man has moodle on IIS and Win2012r2 😁 And and has a same trouble((( Couldt some one new, how to check ssl connnection to BBB from win server, and if it needs insert new CA-s ???

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: You should be able to check simply by opening a web browser on your server and connecting to the BBB server URL. you should get no warnings and no errors from the https status. If there are errors, use windows update to get the new CAs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: There are no errors with web browser opening bbb and system is up to date.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: So, it should work, or maybe your problems (if any) are not related to the expired Let's Encrypt CAs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: BigBlueButton missing icons
ResponsesInList.Text: The double square brackets appear when moodle does not find the English translation for that string. In this case, you have an updated BBB server that offers the new options to protect and publish and your moodle plugin is not up-to-date with these new options.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: BigBlueButton missing icons
ResponsesInList.Text: Anyway, you should get rid of the square brackets in one of these ways: cleaning/purge the cache of your moodle (the strings will be reloaded) by adding the two strings to the lang/en/bigbluebuttonbn.php of your bbb plugin if that tokens are missing after the step 1

It is not quite the same as it will need to support multiple meetings per activity. The major issue I see now is that the API used by GoToMeeting has changed. When you set up a developer account in https://goto-developer.logmeininc.com and create a new App, you will find that the API Product is listed as: G2M_Development. Previously, it was G2M_Development_ExtendedOAuthv1. With this change, I get the following error when I go to /mod/gotowebinar/configtest.php: When I investigate a little further, I find this in the response body when the plugin makes a  curl request: "OAuth API v1 has been decommissioned as announced in February 2018, please switch to OAuth API v2 documented here: https://goto-developer.logmeininc.com/oauth-migration-guide . Please reach out to Support ( developer-support@logmein.com ) with questions." I think the switch on the GoToMeeting end happened quite recently as this was working a month ago. Creating a dev account at this time used the G2M_Development_ExtendedOAuthv1 API product - which does work. But now the API product expects OAuth API v2 to be used so it looks like the module won't work unless the API calls are updated to match this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Backup course with BBB recording

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Backup course with BBB recording
ResponsesInList.Text: AFAIK , the BBB recordings stay on the BBB server , so into the backup, there will be the resources/ activities that will point to the recordings, but not the recordings themselves (usually they are very large). If you restore your course in a moodle connected to the same BBB server you should be able to view the recordings, otherwise not. To transfer the BBB recordings, you should transfer/copy them between the BBB servers involved.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi at all. Anyone can tell me if the procedure for obtaining detailed log files described in the web page https://jffederico.medium.com/bigbluebutton-activity-completion-in-moodle-b3269adf4c34 is valid even if the BBB servers are behind Scalelite servers (Lazy Deployment). If not valid, is there a way to have detailed log files in MOODLE using BBB servers  behind Scalelite (Lazy or Blinside Networks Deployment)? Thanks for sharing

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Davide, I already told you this. The fact that the BBB server is behind Scalelite or any other Loadbalancer does not affect the outcome. BBB is the one performing the callback. The payload that comes from BBB is received by Moodle through the plugin and stored in the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_logs table. So, if you wanted to extract that data from there you need other plugin. I am guessing that some report plugin or external application such as intelliboard would help you (just guessing).

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: thanks Jesus, now I try. It is important for my fellow teachers to be able to track student activities in videoconferencing (at least the connection time). We noticed that irregular exits from the meeting (for example closing the browser window) are not noted in the log file. Thank you so much for your valuable work

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: No, they are not tracked. And there is no way to track those exits because right now there is no way to stream data into Moodle (a BBB limitation) and there is no way to process batch events in Moodle and tie them to a correct timestamp (a Moodle limitation).

ResponsesInList.Title: Error message after upgrade zoom plugin: "Sorry, but you do not currently have permissions to do that (View Zoom meetings)."
ResponsesInList.Text: We are going to upgrade Moodle from version 3.6 to 3.8 and is using a UAT Moodle site for testing. The current zoom plugin is v2.2 .We tried to upgrade the zoom plugin by directly replacing the mod/zoom directory with the new v3.7 version. The upgrade was not successful and the old version number was retained. I could not but try to uninstall the current v2.2 in advance. It was undesirable because the teachers' zoom schedule activities would be removed. Finally, the zoom plugin was successfully upgraded to v3.7 after uninstalling v2.2 version. Apparently, everything at the setting of zoom plugin looks normal. I was able to set up the zoom schedule on Moodle. Unfortunately, when I clicked the zoom activity icon in an attempt to start a zoom meeting. It prompted the below error message. "Sorry, but you do not currently have permissions to do that (View Zoom meetings)." I could only uninstall the v3.7 zoom plugin and reinstalled v2.2 again, hoping that this could get rid of the error message. Nevertheless, the error message persists. It seems that the database content had changed during the previous trial of zoom plugin upgrade. Please advise how to fix this problem. Thank you very much. Best Regards, Kelvin Ma

ResponsesInList.Title: [Solved]: Error message after upgrade zoom plugin: "Sorry, but you do not currently have permissions to do that (View Zoom meetings)."
ResponsesInList.Text: I uninstalled the zoom plugin. Then, login phpmyadmin and delete the last 3 tables related to zoom, including mdl_zoom, mdl_zoom_meeting_details, mdl_zoom_meeting_participants. And then, upgrade the zoom plugin to version 3.7. The upgrade is successful this time. The error message no longer appears when I click the zoom activity icon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing two bigbluebutton plugins
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
#!/bin/bash
# Change  BigBlueButton Module Name.
# Module version = 2019042009
# Module release = 2.3.4
#
# If you do not have rename installed, install it first
# sudo apt install rename
#
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/g' {} +
find . -type d -execdir rename 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/' '{}' \+
find . -type f -exec rename 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/' '{}' \;
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BigBlueButtonBN/LiveClass1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BIGBLUEBUTTONBN/LIVECLASS1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BIGBLUEBUTTON/LIVECLASS1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/icon-bigbluebutton/icon-liveclass1/g' {} +
```

ResponsesInList.Title: How to transfer courses along with recordings sticked to them
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Everybody! I've got a problem and looking for suggestion how to resolve it. My history of using BBB+Moodle started in 2016. That time I've installed VM with Moodle 2.6 and VM with BBB 0.81. We used this system successfully till 2018 year, that time we decided to upgrade Moodle to brand new 3.6.1 and BBB to 2.0 beta. I established new VM, got fresh installation for BBB and I copied all recordings from 0.81 to 2.0. Then I switched off old 0.81 BBB and tested communication of Moodle 2.6 with new BBB server 2.0 and everything worked fine. That time we decided to save time and let both Moodle (old one 2.6 and new one 3.6.1) worked with one instance of BBB 2.0. I was going to move my courses alog with recordings of the old Moodle instance 2.6 to the new one 3.6.1 later and I supposed it should be easy for me, but I mistaken... So I adjusted my firewall and two different Moodle web-sites worked on different ports fine. Untill I decided to upgrade BBB to the latest 2.2 release. The reason was Adobe Flash EOL and I wanted new technologies like HTML5 client, using it on mobile phones and all the new features which appeared in BBB since my last upgrade. I did that upgrade the same way as before - just made fresh installation using BBB-conf script and copied all my folders with recordings to the new VM. Then I set up new Internet connection, because BBB required wide broadband channel, and I changed IP, readjust everything, domain name, firewall and so on. Finally I tested it with new Moodle instance - everything worked fine! I was glad till the moment I tested old Moodle instance 2.6 - it was unsuccessful. Of course I changed secret key (aka SALT), but I din't know should I change URL (I left it the same, because I didn't change domain name, only adjusted new IP in DNS records). Summarizing all up-mentioned my question is: "Does somebody know the way to transfer courses as well as lists of BBB recordings which belong to them from old 2.6 Moodle instance to new 3.6.1" I've tried it today and it transfered with empty list of recordings, only other kind of standard Moodle plugins and other content... The problem is that old 2.6 Moodle also lost all recording lists... I am in despair! Please suggest any workable way to resurrect my webinars! Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: All BBB recordings have dissapeared, RecordingsBN option no longer showing
ResponsesInList.Text: In our issue (the one from S Warner above) we had force mode enabled for groups, which had the net result of hiding all recordings - even if "any participant option was chosen - presumably because no group was tagged onto the recording. We removed force groups and also changed the activity to either visible groups or no groups - and the recordings showed up. We have since not opted for group mode per se but use the restricted Access option to limit who can join (image attached).

ResponsesInList.Text: Hello dear, we have an environment where Moodle 3.8.2 is used and BBB 2.2.23 is installed on a separate ubuntu 16.04 server . We are using BBB plugin 2.3.4. When we record a session it is taking more than 24 hours to appear in moodle. many recording made two days ago didn't show up yet the processed files is empty /var/bigbluebutton/recording/process/presentation the published files is empty /var/bigbluebutton/recording/publish/presentation/ they only show up in the playback /var/bigbluebutton/published/presentation we run bbb-conf --check and bbb-conf --status and they showed nothing wrong

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB recordings are taking very long time to appear
ResponsesInList.Text: it has been noticed that BBB is parsing them in /var/bigbluebutton/recording/process/presentation one by one. once a folder is done he moves to the next. but it is very slow. each recording is taking more than one hour

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB recordings are taking very long time to appear
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Elie, Let me start by poining out that this is not the best place for posting this question. Since it is BBB related you may be better off by asking in the bigblubutton-dev google group. But, you are correct. The recording processor is a single thread process and that is exactly what happens when meetings are to big or the server is processing too many. There have been plans over the years of re-implementing the recording processor but stability and features on the core components always trump this initiative. Let's remember though that the single server deployment is not meant to be run at high scale. In that spirit, and if you don't want to write your own recording processor (which is what every single company in BBB ecosystem is doing for scaling their clusters), you could have multiple bigbluebutton servers under Scalelite. You would not gain speed and compute power by spreading meeting, therefore recording processing between servers, but at the same time, you would increase your capacity for live sessions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB recordings are taking very long time to appear
ResponsesInList.Text: thank you Jesus for your reply

The only thing that surprises me is that, when I use Bigbluebutton plugin, even when it is only me, (late at night when the students are not participating in the classes) it uses 100% of on of the threads and makes the server really heavy. Ant when I have lots of users, the server crashes completely because of heavy cpu load. as you can see I have a powerful server which can handle thousands of users simultaneously. Why should the plugin drain the cpu so? this is when there is very little site visits. When only me using the bigbluebutton plugin: this is when we have 250 users participating class: should I delete the recordings?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: bigbluebutton uses 100% cpu
ResponsesInList.Text: It is the lookup for the recordings, and it is because you have too many in one single instance. But I agree, it should not be the case. Because the problem is in MySQL , I would guess that your deployment is missing an index in the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_logs table. What version of the plugin do you have? I am interested in solving this issue with you. You can ping me through email jesus@blindsidenetworks.com JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle slows down when Bigbluebutton API loads recordings
ResponsesInList.Text: I have near 800 students cocurrently in near 30 meetings. At the start of meeting because of time needed to load recording, moodle will slow down extremely. CPU usage for mysql proccess will be very high (near 18GHz). Is there any way to solve the performance issue?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle slows down when Bigbluebutton API loads recordings
ResponsesInList.Text: Wow, that is a lot! How many servers do you have?, you are supposed to have no more than 100 users per server . For a case like that you should have at least 7 BBB servers behind a loadbalancer or broker such as Sclalite. The other question is, how many recording do you have in that room. There should not be a problem with that, unless you are missing an index in bigbluebuttonbn_logs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB 2.2.21 : "Condition: start condition failed at ..."
ResponsesInList.Text: That's normal. It means that your processing service finished to process (ie. convert to MP4/webm/opus etc) all your recordings and now it stopped. It will resume again once more /var/bigbluebutton/recording/status/sanity/*.done files appear (i.e. raw recording content that has passed sanity check service and it is now ready to be processed).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: hello - our fix was down to a problem with our scalelite setup rather than BBB. BBB was correctly publishing the recordings. The import script is specific to scalelite and just copies the completed published recordings from individual BBB servers to the central scalelite server. The script is here if you have scalelite - /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts I've updated our BBBBN plugin to 2.3.4 and moodle to 3.9 today and all is working correctly for us so don't think the plugin is the culprit. Are you using scalelite or is it a single BBB instance? Are any recordings being published? They can start to take days if you stick with webm format and have a lot of sessions on the go. In our busiest period (we had 4 BBB servers and rang between 400-600 users across them with 5-10 meeting, only one webcam showing on each meeting thankfully) I had to change to mp4 (which also made my IOS users happy) to get recordings showing up in anything like a sensible timeframe. Have you used the bbb-record command? Used with --watch it will at least show you the various workers are running - https://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/recording.html I also used to fish around the /var/bigbluebutton/published/presentation/ folder, ls -ltr will show latest recordings at bottom which can help diagnose problems. If you haven't signed up to the BBB google groups I would recommend it. I have fixed most problems with a combination of these moodle forums with the google groups.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ricardo, Yeah, that is a BBB issue. A big one. I was not aware of that. And I just reported to the guys who work on the recordings. The recordings are still there. It seems to be the API that is not picking them up. This means that, because it has nothing to do with Moodle or the Plugin, they will show up again after BBB is updated (or patched). Hopefully there will be an update soon. I would recommend you to keep an eye on the bigbluebutton-dev mailing list. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Alright, I broke my own BBB server :D. And I don't know where exactly the problem is, but I passed the report along. There are two things you can try. 1. Restart your BBB server. It seems that the update includes changing one of the libraries required by the API for accessing the recordings. Since the API is still running, it has the reference to the old version. On restart, the API starts using the new one. 2. If that doesn't work, what worked for me (I was doing something else) was to run bbb-install.sh again (in the same way I did a few weeks ago) right after performing the apt-get update. Can you please report back which one of the procedures (if any) worked for you? Thanks, JF

About security: Well, a service won't take care of the security of the whole server. It is the responsibility of the system administrator in coordination with the network administrator. Either way, BBB is a separate piece of software. You have to consult their site for more. If you mean the BBB plug-in for Moodle , the discussions are in the Web conferencing plugins forum.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton
ResponsesInList.Text: Our experience is that running a BBB server is not straightforward. This is not a criticism of BBB - it holds true for all software of this type. BBB is a perfectly good choice but I would recommend buying the service from Blindside rather than doing it yourself. Unless you enjoy a challenge.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: Can you tell more about your set up? There are a lot of possibilities and it is not possible to say from your description. Always provide versions of everything, (Moodle, the plugin, BBB). Also if the BBB server you are using is the one by default, you have your own, you are hosting BBB somewhere else) And perhaps describe more when exactly that is happening. You mean the user is kicked out the session? or is just showing the error before getting the session?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: hello Jesus, the bbb is hosted locally and the default. moodle version is 3.8.2 and the bbb plugin version is 2.2.12. bbb server version 2.2.0 the user is kicked out of the session and giving the message as per the pictures. first time it happened at minute 96 and second time at minute 92

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: First of all, I would recommend you to update your plugin to the latest version. That is way outdated. It seems to me that your server is configured to hold sessions with a maximum of 1.5 hours duration by default (it can be confirmed if all users are kicked out at the same time).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: the defaultMeetingDuration is already set to 0. i will perform the plugin upgrade. is there any risk that the BBB activity in Moodle will be lost? since to upgrade we will have to remove the plugin and install the new one. we cannot do a simple upgrade Elie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: Updating the plugin is normally pretty safe. If anything goes wrong you could revert the code with no problem. In those cases the issue may be the database . For that, and if you want to play safe, make sure to backup the tables mdl_bigbluebuttonbn and mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_logs in case you have to revert it. The most important part is, do not, I repeat DO NOT uninstall the plugin. Because you would lose all the activities and references to the recordings. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: Well noted Jesus. i have the 'Install this update' button missing next to the BBB plugin. I guess a configuration file has to be changed in order to enable it. Do you have any idea what it could be? Elie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing parameter: moodle-bbb
ResponsesInList.Text: You may have figured out already, but still, in case someone else have the same question. You only need to replace the content in the directory containing bigbluebuttonbn with the code of the version you want to install. What I normally do in those cases is to rename the current directory as .bigbluebuttonbn, so Moodle ignores its content, and then unzip the new version in a new bigbluebuttonbn directory. And simply go to notifications and Moodle will do the rest. Also, don't jump from a super old version to the newest one. It is better to do the updates incrementally if there are too many versions in between. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to download a BBB recording with presentation from moodle

ResponsesInList.Title: Can i host Moodle and BigBlueButton together on a sever?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can i host Moodle and BigBlueButton together on a sever?
ResponsesInList.Text: You could, if you had a server that is large enough for supporting BBB, but with a major tweak to nginx, and only under specific circumstances that include to be using Ubuntu 18.04, to install Moodle on Nginx manually. Of course, you must be comfortable performing System Administrator tasks on linux and have root access on that server. And even in that case, we (the BBB and BN developers) don't recommend to go that way. You will be better off by installing BBB in a separated machine. JF

ResponsesInList.Text: Absolutely. You can access that BBB server even from apps other than Moodle if you have the correct App for that (Greenlight for example).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB plugin - recording files

What you see in the Room or Acivity are links that are tetrieved form the BBB server once (and only while) the recordings are available in the BigBlueButton server after being processed. You can find documentation about that in https://docs.bigbluebutton.org or ask for more ideas in bigbluebutton-setup mailing list.

ResponsesInList.Title: A simple authentication mechanism for BBB recordings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I just wanted to share a mechanism that I have crudely implemented for authenticating recording links. As we know that BigBlueButton recordings are kind of "unlisted" in the fact that once the link is available, anyone can watch it. Hence using Nginx auth_request submodule, I have implemented a mechanism to authenticate the requests with some tweaks in the BBB plugin. Along with BBB server link for API, I have added a new column called BBB recordings link. So I have bbb.xyz.com handling my API requests and rec.xyz.com serving my recordings although they are on the same server (this is not really necessary, and the same bbb.xyz.com itself can be used This mechanism only works if moodle is also hosted on abc.xyz.com and cookie is shared at *.xyz.com that is cookie is available to both xyz and rec subdomains A new file called bbb_auth.php is created to which meetingID and bbb activity id are sent as GET parameters. if the meetingID is a part of BBB activity, a 200 OK is returned else 404 is returned. This bbb_auth.php link is used in the nginx rec.xyz.com auth_request field configuration. So when a logged in user from moodle visits the recording link, the recording link in the backend passes the cookie and requests bbb_auth.php for a reply, ONLY if the reply is 200 OK, the recording link (and all the audio, video and image assets involved) will be served. This allows for an authentication between Moodle and the BigBlueButton server through Nginx with minimal modifications. Please suggest if there are better mechanisms to do with without the cookie sharing constraint.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle integration
ResponsesInList.Text: You can modify the file config-dist.php of the plug in with your URL and secret. This is the default configuration: $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['server_url'] = ' http://test-install.blindsidenetworks.com/bigbluebutton/' ; $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['shared_secret'] = '8cd8ef52e8e101574e400365b55e11a6';

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle integration
ResponsesInList.Text: You only do that if you want the setting to disapear for administrators. Otherwise they can use the Admin UI through the Plugin Settings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle integration
ResponsesInList.Text: If those are your own Moodle and BBB servers, yes. You just go to the settings of the plugin and at the very top, replace the URL and secret with your BBB server ones. If you are on someone elese Moodle server, the feature may have been removed so you are not able to change it.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, everyone, I have a  free Moodlecloud account with BigBlueButton installed.  I am part of a small group of tutors and we have been experimenting with videoconferencing with our students for online tutorials and meeting.  We live in a rural/small town area.  The wifi varies in strength.  On average this morning, the link speed is 300mb/s.  I am using a laptop, running Ubuntu.  We have also experimented with smartphones and iPads. When I had a webconference with a student last week, the connection was on and off quite a bit.  We eventually gave up and decided to try again this week.  Does anyone have any ideas what we can do to get a clear stream? Thank you very, very much! Nell

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weconferencing in rural area - audio visual problems with BBB
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, again, everyone, I haven't figured out yet how to take this down. Everything is all set. The problems have been resolved. Have a lovely day! Nell

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weconferencing in rural area - audio visual problems with BBB
ResponsesInList.Text: It is always nice, if you describe how you solved the problem. There are others looking for answers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weconferencing in rural area - audio visual problems with BBB
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much for your reply.  It is good to know there are others out there struggling with the same issue. For me, I am a bit ashamed of how simple the solution turned out to be.  After advice from a friend, I moved my modem and router to a higher level so it wasn't blocked by anything.  I stay very close to the modem and router when I am trying to videoconference.   The stream is not perfect but it works. I hope that helps.  What problems are you having?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Weconferencing in rural area - audio visual problems with BBB

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB and Missing icon issue for Moodle Docs link

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB and Missing icon issue for Moodle Docs link
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi @Chris and @Mary, I am sorry I missied this post. Yes, you are right. This is enterely imputable to the BBB plugin v2.2.9 caused by a badly tested snippet taken verbatim from a generic piece of code whithout exhausing al the possible outcomes. Totally my fault. It clashes with any theme or plugin using icons with the root icon-*. It was fixed a while back (end of Feb) but released as part of the last release last week (v2.2.11) with a few other cumulative fixes. You should update ASAP. Versions 2.2.9 and 2.2.10 have been removed. @Chris, we are about to release 2.3 which comes with a big refactoring, I would love to have you on board for giving it a try.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improving Web Conferencing Software
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Jules, We would LOVE to have HTML5 BBB on Moodle. Flash is out of the question for us. It seems there is a release but we cant access it on the blindsidenetworks test server . This seems to be taking an awfully long time. The demo was out in 2017. I'm keen to be interviewed. Rob Mills

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improving Web Conferencing Software
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rob, Good news.  We have released BigBlueButton 2.2-beta, which is the first version where the HTML5 client comes to the foreground as the main client. We made the announcement here to our bigbluebutton-dev mailing list: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/bigbluebutton-dev/34SphncjKEw/KJZsbQbEAQAJ . Here's a quote from our announcement The BigBlueButton HTML5 client runs without plugins. There is no Flash, no Java , and no mobile app needed to run the HTML5 client.  The client takes advantage of the latest capabilities of FireFox and Chrome (the recommended browsers on the desktop) and mobile Safari (for iOS 11+ iPhones and iPads). The HTML5 client uses the browser's support for web real-time communication (webRTC) to send and receive high-quality audio, video, and screen sharing.  You'll find the shared video of higher quality than the Flash client.  We use FreeSWITCH for WebRTC audio and Kurento for WebRTC video/screen sharing. The HTML5 client implements the full capabilities for the presenter upload presentation, pan/zoom, and annotate using whiteboard tools (including multi-user whiteboard). The HTML5 client offers more collaboration capabilities (compared with the Flash client) including built-in shared notes (using EtherPad) and ability to share YouTube video during the session (though the shared YouTube video does not appear yet in the recording). The HTML5 client runs on desktop, laptop, chromebook, and mobile devices.  It implements a responsive interface (written in React) that automatically adapts to the screen size.  This means the *same* code and interface is now running across all these devices.  For mobile devices there is no app to install. The HTML5 client runs with the mobile browser which on iOS is mobile Safari browser and on Android is Chrome.  These browsers support using WebRTC to send/receive audio and video.  The supported operating systems on mobile devices is iOS 11+ for Apple iPhones/iPads and Android 6.0+.  The device must support the h.264 codec (which is supported by iOS and most Android phones). We've been testing earlier builds of the HTML5 client on our test server at https://test.bigbluebutton.org/ . While BigBlueButton anyone can use BigBlueButton as a general web conferencing system, the project focuses on the needs of the instructor and student for online learning. With our announcement, anyone can setup their own BigBlueButton server (with HTML5 client as default) by following the install steps at: http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/html/html5-install.html . Regards,... Fred Dixon BigBlueButton HTML5 developer

ResponsesInList.Title: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Can you explain mod_bigbluebuttonbn version 2.2.6 (2017101014) settings; 1. When you create a new BBB-activity on course you can choose instance type Room/Activity with recordings Room/Activity only Recordings only What is the difference between these settings? 2. Under "Activity/Room settings"-topic you can choose "Session can be recorded" Why is this setting here if instance type dictates that the session can be recorded? Or do you need both: "Room/Activity with recordings" "Session can be recorded" before you can record the session?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Urpo, Very simple. Room/Activity with recordings, is the normal and regular room we have had since BigBlueButtonBN version 2.0. Meaning an instance that can be used for joining sessions that may be recorded. If they are and have recording linked to them, the recordings are shown at the bottom. Room Activity only, similar to the first one, BUT with no recordings. This instances won;t give the users even the possibility of recording the session. It is normally used for give students an space for collaboration with no need to be worried about space or the content they recorded. If an existen room is changed to this type, the existent recordings will remain in BBB but they won't be shown. Recordings only, Since the inception of BigBlueButtonBN version 2.2, the plugin named RecordingsBN that was used for showing all the recordings in a course, has been phased out. The reason for that is that there was too many duplicated code and it is always more difficult to maintain more than one plugin. Specially when they have similar functionality. So, In order to have an instance for showing all the recordings in one course you select this type. You can also use this type if you want to show only one recording (or a small set of them) by importing recording from another instance in the same course, or even in a different one. I hope this clarifies things. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Thanks for answering my first question. If I use Room/Activity with recordings do I still need to choose also Session can be recorded -checkbox ? If so don't you think this is redudant now when you can choose this with the room type?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, I think you have your response already but anyways, I'll give you a use case :D. Lets say a teacher wants to have a room with recordings for student collaboration showing a recording from a different course but only want them to have meetings that  should not be recorded. You may argue that students won't have access to start/stop recordngs anyways, but they could if you want to give them moderator capabilites. I know, the convinations are endless, but this is the thing, this plugin has been growing in features and capabilities based on user requests. What does't make much sense to you may be the only way to solve someone else problem. My advice is always to look for the settings that will work for you particular use cases and try to set them up by default, this way your users don't have to be worried for too many combinations. I would say that in your case, if you prefer no to see the checkbox but still want to have all the meetings with the option for being recorded, add this to your config.php $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['recording_default'] = 1; $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['recording_editable'] = 0; I hope this helps. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Password protect BBB virtual classroom
ResponsesInList.Text: We're using the BBB Moodle plugin and have a need to restrict teachers from certain BBB virtual classes. We have courses with several teachers enrolled in them. We want to restrict teachers from entering certain BBB virtual classes in the course. I was thinking it could be done by password protecting the BBB virtual class, but don't see that option available. Is there an option to set a password for a BBB virtual class in Moodle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Password protect BBB virtual classroom
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Gred, Negative. That use case (access with password after the user is already authenticated!) is not covered and it has never been intended to cover it. For restricting access to a room to some users (including teachers) you could use groups and to use an special role for those teachers (non-editing teacher may be used, but I would rather create a custom one for that particular use case. Lets call it TA). Then you enroll the TAs into the course/groups you want them to have access, and for the activity you can add them as moderators in the list of participants. The groups should be set up as "separated". You may have to play around  with the options until you get the set up you need. Good luck, Jesus Federico

ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, I thought that was the case. And how do I confirm that they can't enter the BBB virtual classroom--by logging in as them and trying?

ResponsesInList.Title: Downgrade mod_bigbluebuttonbn and mod_recordingsbn
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I managed to successfully downgrade these two plugins and I would like to share my actions. I did not try it on a live system but on a staging one. Before you begin keep a backup of everything!! You can find the version of a plugin in the version.php file: $plugin->version = 2014070401; My old BBB plugins on Moodle 3.0.9: 1) mod_bigbluebuttonbn version 2015062101 2) mod_recordingsbn version 2014070401 The new BBB plugins that I wanted to use on Moodle 3.0.9: 1) mod_bigbluebuttonbn version 2016051919 2) mod_recordingsbn version 2016051906 Pre-installation steps: a) I have the code in a git repository so if I need to, I can checkout the folders and revert the file changes. b) It is important to keep a back up of the tables that the plugins use. From their " db/install. xml " I found three tables: b.1) bigbluebuttonbn and bigbluebuttonbn_log for bigbluebuttonbn b.2) r ecordingsbn for recordingsbn c) I exported the tables one by one: c.1)   my sql dump -u MYUSERNAME -p MYDATABASE mdl_bigbluebuttonbn > /tmp/moodlelive_bigbluebuttonbn_table.sql c.2)   mysqldump -u MYUSERNAME -p MYDATABASE mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log > /tmp/moodlelive_bigbluebuttonbnlog_table.sql c.3)   mysqldump -u MYUSERNAME -p MYDATABASE mdl_recordingsbn > /tmp/moodlelive_recordingsbn_table.sql Upgrade steps: a) rm -rf mod/bigbluebuttonbn b) rm -rf mod/recordingsbn c) Then, I  'wget' and 'unzip' the zip files from the Moodle plugin directory, in my mod folder. d) From the front-end, I followed the steps and upgraded the plugins. Let's suppose that I am not happy with the new plugins, something does not work and I want to downgrade. At these stage, if I have created new meetings they will be lost, if I apply the following steps so please make sure that you only want to downgrade without migrating any "new" data. Downgrade steps: a) rm -rf mod/bigbluebuttonbn b) rm -rf mod/recordingsbn c) git checkout -- mod/bigbluebuttonbn d) git checkout -- mod/recordingsbn At the moment, I  have got the old plugin files that were stored in my GIT repository. e) A table in the database keeps the new versions of the plugins that I installed, I must update these values otherwise Moodle will never use the older plugins versions and I will not be able to downgrade! e.1) ID for mod_bigbluebuttonbn: select * from mdl_config_plugins where plugin = 'mod_bigbluebuttonbn'; e.2) ID for mod_recordingsbn: select * from mdl_config_plugins where plugin = 'mod_recordingsbn'; e.3) update mdl_config_plugins set value = '2015062101' where id = THE_ID_FROM e.1; E.4) update mdl_config_plugins set value = '2014070401' where id = THE_ID_FROM e.2; f) So, up until now we have put in place the older versions in the database and we need to import the backups: f.1) mysql -u MYUSERNAME -p MYDATABASE < /tmp/moodlelive_bigbluebuttonbn_table.sql f.2) mysql -u MYUSERNAME -p MYDATABASE < /tmp/moodlelive_bigbluebuttonbnlog_table.sql f.3) mysql -u MYUSERNAME -p MYDATABASE < /tmp/moodlelive_recordingsbn_table.sql Refreshing the front-end will prompt you to update the database, click on the button and then check if you can use the plugins - perhaps you will need to update the secret and the URL of BBB server on the appropriate screen. It worked for me without issues, if someone tried something else please share it! Best wishes, AN

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Downgrade from 2.2 to 2.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Panayiotis, I can't really answer your question but I can contribute a bit because I am trying this plugin at the moment. Do not uninstall the plugin by any chance, because you will lose the table with the relevant information (recording names etc). Why do not you try the following scenario: On a dev server (not on your live Moodle), remove the folder mod/bigbluebuttonbn and 'wget' and 'unzip' the version you want, in mod/. Then, check if this works for you in order to apply it on the live one. Best wishes, Antony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Downgrade from 2.2 to 2.1

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Downgrade from 2.2 to 2.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, First of all, yes. DON'T uninstall RecordingsBN (yet) nor BigBlueButtonBN. There is no easy way to downgrade BigBlueButtonBN as there are some changes to the database . I haven't confirmed it, but I am guessing that some of them will make v2.1.x fail. Anyways, the ideal solution is to migrate the current RecordingsBN instances in your Moodle server by creating a corresponding BigBlueButtonBN one (with the same name) in the same courses/ sections . This is because as you may have noticed, BigBlueButtonBN includes the functionality RecordingsBN used to have. Which is to show in one instance all the recordings that belong to a course. Within the new version you would need to add a BigBlueButtonBN and configure it to act as a resource by selecting the type "Recordings Only" when adding it to your course. So the only noticeable difference will be the icon. Right now all the migration has to be done manually, which may be painful if you have a large number of RecordingsBN instances already. Well all this you may have figured out already, so my contribution here is a new version (v1.3.3 or 2016051907) of the RecordingsBN plugin. This version includes an option only available to Administrators for migrating the RecordingsBN instances into BigBlueButtonBN ones. See screen caps attached. Now, if you can please give it a try and give us your feedback so we can proceed to fix whatever you find or to release it right away, that would be very much appreciated.. Thanks, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: BigBlueButton - is there a way to NOT show the recordings to the students
ResponsesInList.Text: We let students record their sessions in BBB, but the BigBlueButtonBN plugin shows the recordings afterwards, also to the students, which we do not want. Is there a way that the recordings are hidden for the students but shown for the teacher? WE use BBB 1.1 with the latest plugin. The old BBB plugins were fine in that, but now the recordings are integrated in the BigBlueButtonBN plugin. A pity because there is another plugin specially for showing the recordings. Hope to hear from you. Many thanks. Nick

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton - is there a way to NOT show the recordings to the students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nick, I think there is a misconception here on what the capabilities in the previous version were and the ones the current one are. With BigBlueButtonBN 2.1.x the recordings belonging to a Room were also shown to all the uses who have access to the Room. RecordingsBN was used as a view in order to show ALL the recordings in a course. But this use case was not changed at all. With BigBlueButtonBN 2.2, the functionality offered by these two plugins was merged, which means that you can have an instance that has a Room/Activity with no recordings, it can be a Room/Activity showing its own recordings (same as the standard Room in v2.1.x) or a resource with Recordings only (same as an instance of the previous RecordingsBN) The use case you are trying to cover has never been considered, although you were able to hide the recordingsBN instance from students using the Moodle capabilities. Nonetheless, there is a workaround you could try. This would be to create a group per user in that course and enroll them. Students should see only the recordings for the group (or groups) they belong, but Teachers should be able to see all of them. I hope this helps. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bigbluebuttonbn - Moodle 3.4
ResponsesInList.Text: All right guys, with those last messages I see where the problem is. The first thing I have to tell you is that things can be faster if you provide the right versions when asking for help. In this case, along with the 2.2-beta (which doesn't tell much really) there is a 10 digits number. That is the one we really use to identify issues particularly related to a version. I am assuming you guys had 2017101002 (that may have been the first report). The issue you have now is telling me that you either have 2017101003 or 2017101004. You have two options here: The first is to update to 2017101004 (if you are still in 2017101003), which was released yesterday to the Moodle Plugin Directory. But in this case there is still an edge case lasting. The activities created with 2017101003 are not going to work. You would need to delete them and create them again. If that is important for you, you can take the second option. That is to find the latest code in the github repository (master branch). The version  2017101005 solves that edge case as well. https://github.com/blindsidenetworks/moodle-mod_bigbluebuttonbn This version is likely going to be promoted to RC this week. So if it works for you, you could take the first option and wait to do the next update until the newest version is released there. Please let us know if you run into any other issue after the update. Jesus Federico.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I can not configure my server ip for moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Your BigBlueButton server is not correctly installed. You have to follow the steps in this document (including the troubleshooting part as you have some issues there) http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/install/install.html As this issue has nothing to do with Moodle, you should look for help in the BigBlueButton mailing lists. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup The main problem is that you installed BBB in the same server you installed Moodle. And even though that is possible, it requires some black magic for proxying the requests. You should better install them in separated boxes. I don't know what exactly you did, but right now it seems that you have two applications listening the port 80. You have to have a way to redirect the request to the application you really want. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Saving settings on Big Blue Button?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, Does anyone know if it is possible to save settings on Big Blue Button? Especially audio and video settings? So far, both moderator and viewers have to allow audio, video and screensharing every time they use it which is quite tiresome. I hope this is the right forum for this question. Thanks! Best, Sara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Saving settings on Big Blue Button?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sara, Do you mean to save the WebRTC/Flash/ Java permissions so the the browser "remembers" the next time the user uses the resource? Well, for these permissions we need to remember that this is a Browser thing and not a BBB one. And as far I can remember they are required only the first time you launch into this site (unless you clean cache and settings) The WebRTC/Flash permissions (meaning webcam and audio) should be remembered (at least Chrome and Firefox do) as long as you always use the same BBB server , meaning you are not behind a load balancer that is giving you access to a different server every time. Java, well I am afraid you need to download (end execute) the extension ever time. In Chrome you can check what permissions you have for the particular site once you are in the session. If you click Manage microphone settings you can see what sites have been allowed to use this resource. Same for the webcam and Flash. Now, for the Flash settings, there is also a section when you can change the default behaviour for flash (which I would not recommend) But again keep in mind that these are settings in the browser so every single user accessing that site has to do that. if you mean the tests of webcam and mic included in BBB, these can also be disabled in BBB by editing the config. xml file. /var/www/bigbluebutton/client/conf/config.xml You have to be the admin of that BBB server and the changes will apply to all the users of that particular server. I personally would not recommend it as you may hit some other issues of people with Hw or OS problems not able to identify. Which means a lot of unnecessary requests to the Technical Support team I hope this helps JF P.S. It is fine to ask anywhere about this kind of questions, but your chances of getting a better and quicker response to questions directly related to BBB are maximised in the BBB mailing list bigbluebutton-setup

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton Cost/Additional Services
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Hardy, Interesting question. Are you looking for commercial support for a particular project? You can reach out with any of the companies listed here: https://bigbluebutton.org/commercial-support/ As you may have figured out by now, BigBlueButton is an open source project for Web conferencing. Same as Moodle is for Content Managment for Education (LMS). The project itself doesn't make any money directly. Instead it is supported by the companies that are part of the ecosystem. Responding to your question, as for any other Open Source project, free doesn't mean free as a free beer, but free as in freedom. There are tons of resources out there that explain the business model for open source projects. You can start taking a look to this one: https://handsontable.com/blog/articles/5-successful-business-models-for-web-based-open-source-projects Regards, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
ResponsesInList.Text: This is an issue entirely related to BigBlueButton itself and no to the Moodle plugin. If you have your own BigBlueButton server you may want to try asking for help in the bigbluebutton mailing lists. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-dev or https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup If you are using test-install (the server that comes by default), there may have been an issue with the server at the time you were testing. The problems don't usually just happen, so an update was in process or it is on its way. With test-install you either have to be patient and wait or report it to the bigbluebutton mailing list as it may be an issue the developers are not aware of. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Jesus, I'm using the standard plugin on Moodle, since I'm currently using shared hosting on CPanel (and apparently I can't install BBB there. I'm going to run a stress test tonight with multiple users to check if everything's now ok. I appreciate your feedback. It's good to know there's nothing else I should be doing on my side.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
ResponsesInList.Text: The plugin doesn't do anything by itself. The plugin let you create Moodle activities that will let you make use of some functionality inside the LMS, BUT, you have to have a BigBlueButton server where to run the meetings. It is true that the plugin comes pre-configured to work with a BigBlueButton server provided for free by Blindside Networks, BUT (again) it is not meant to be for production, only for testing. It is OK if you use the server as much as you need/want. The server works normally fine, but as it is used (for free) by lots of users daily it may be overloaded in times. Also it always runs the latest build with gives users access to all the new features and capabilities, although the downside of that is also that in times there may be hidden bugs not detected in development. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jesus, Thanks for the explanation. It's really helpful.
