ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Is there any way to be able for users to enter the meetings without re-entering login and password in adobe connect activity module? I set HTTP Authentication Header to rl-user-id but its not working. I'm using moodle 2.9 and adobe connect 9. (adobe in X.site.com  - windows 2008 server | moodle in Y.site.com - linux server) Best, Hamed

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users should enter login and password again to enter the meeting in adobe connect!
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Hamed, Without having tested the SSO with a self hosted Connect 9 instance, it may be due to an API change with the latest version of Connect. One way of investigating this is to look at the Connect server logs and see what is happening when a user attempts to join a meeting from Moodle to see what is happening. Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users should enter login and password again to enter the meeting in adobe connect!
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm using in production Moodle 2.7 and Adobe Connect 9.3 fully patched and the SSO is working fine, the users logged into moodle can access the Connect rooms without  entering their credentials (note that Adobe Connect usually does not share any user password with moodle). We are using the free plugin available from Moodle.org repository. Double check that all the changes into the xml config files in Connect are correctly done, restart adobe connect, and should work. Please note that patching Adobe connect could restore some configs to the original value, so you need to change them again: there are some posts into this forum that i did some months ago on this matter. hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users should enter login and password again to enter the meeting in adobe connect!
ResponsesInList.Text: I really appreciate Sergio Rabellino 's clear and accurate guidance as well as his helpful answers to my messages. And here is the solution: Edit " custom.ini " and add " HTTP_AUTH_HEADER=AVALUE " ( AVALUE can be anything you like. I wrote dadparvar, my firm's name). And save it. Go to your adobe connect settings in your moodle (normally it is somewhere like here: http://your-moodle.com/admin/settings.php?section=modsettingadobeconnect ) and in " HTTP Authentication Header " field, write what you wrote instead of "AVALUE" in last step and save it. Edit " web.xml " located in " appserv/web/ " and enable the " headerauthenticationfilter " section, but you need to disable the API " init-param " section. And save it. Restart your adobe connect. That's it. Now there is no need to enter username (or email) and password to enter the adobe connect class and the users will be directly entered to class as they click on the button. Regards, Hamed

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton test server limitation and periods to access
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi m anikandan , This test-install server is a free, public open one. You can use it for as long as you need/want. The terms of use are shown in the chat box when a user joins the session. Just a few things to keep in mind: - it is meant to be a testing server not a production server - it is open, which means anyone can access your sessions at anytime. - it can be used by everybody which means that there may be cases when the maximum capacity is reached - its recordings will last only for 14 days - the administrators could shut it down any time. We don't do that, and we do our best to keep it up and running, but sometimes maintenance interruptions can happen and they not always can be scheduled. This is why we recommend people to have dedicated servers for production. Regards, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton test server limitation and periods to access
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, There is no official packaging for Ubuntu 17.04 and there won't be. You can find multiple references to Ubuntu 16.04 as the only way to get it to work through packaging in the official documentation: http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/install/install.html -------------------------- We (the core developers) have designed, developed, installed, and tested BigBlueButton 1.1 on Ubuntu: 16.04 64-bit (Xenial Xerus). That’s what we recommend you use. We have not tested BigBlueButton 1.1 on any other version of Ubuntu (or Linux). Why the focus on Ubuntu 16.04? It’s a choice of quality over quantity. Long ago we concluded that its better for the project to have solid, well-tested, well-documented installation for a specific version of Linux that works really, really well than to try and support may OS and have none of them work well. --------------------------

ResponsesInList.Title: BigBlueButton 1.1 released
ResponsesInList.Text: BigBlueButton is an open source web conferencing system for online learning. It provides instructors with real-time sharing of audio, video, slides, chat, polls, emojis and their screen.  BigBlueButton can also record and playback online sessions for later viewing. The BigBlueButton project is pleased to announce the release of BigBlueButton 1.1. We have been working with the Moodle community for over six years now with the goal of providing remote students a high-quality online learning experience.  This release is a significant step towards that goal. Major new features in BigBlueButton 1.1 include: Breakout Rooms – Instructors can group students into breakout rooms for increased collaboration. Instructors can monitor activity in the breakout rooms and set a time limit for collaboration (see ). Closed Captioning – BigBlueButton enables a stenographer to provide live closed captions in multiple languages during a session. After the session finishes, the captions will appear as subtitles in the recording (see ). Faster Screen Sharing – Screen sharing is faster, works across all browsers (using a Java application that launches outside the browser) and now captures cursors (see ). GreenLight – Administrators can install a new front-end, called GreenLight, that makes it easy for users to quickly create meetings, invite others, and manage recordings on a BigBlueButton server . Using Docker, administrators can install on the BigBlueButton server itself (no need for a separate server). GreenLight is written in Rails 5 and can be easily customized by any rails developer (see source on GitHub ). Ubuntu 16.04 packages – This release installs on Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit (the most recent long-term support release from Canonical) and uses `systemd` for new start/stop scripts for individual components. For more information on this release see detailed list of new features and issues fixed in BigBlueButton 1.1 . We recommend anyone running an earlier version of BigBlueButton to setup a new Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit server, install this latest version and copy over any previous recordings (see the above install documentation for details). Many learning management systems have integrated BigBlueButton into their products using the BigBlueButton API .  By far, the deepest integration with with Moodle. According to the Moodle stats over 4000 sites have installed the BigBlueButtonBN plugin .  Currently, it's ranked #5 in overall downloads (Look out Academi, we're coming for you . We welcome any feedback on this release.  Like Moodle, BigBlueButton and the BigBlueButtonBN plugin are open source projects. For more information, visit https://bigbluebutton.org/ . Regards,... Fred Dixon -- BigBlueButton Project Manager

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Adam, according to your profile, you seem to be responsible for some kind of web conferencing solution, so your question here appears to be loaded. I use BigBlueButton for teaching and online meetings and find it exemplary.  I use appear.in for ad hoc meetings and quick chats with students.  I also use Google Hangouts and occasionally Skype for the same purpose.  I've had very few problems with either.  In particular appear.in (which requires no registration) and Hangouts (which most people are already registered for)  are particularly attractive. If you need more information to improve your product, I'm available for hire and can provide detailed reports on user experience from both the teaching side and the learner side.  if you want to tell us about your product, then I'm sure that those who are interested can check it out for themselves via your profile. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video conferencing
ResponsesInList.Text: The video conferencing answer for Modle is Big Blue Button (BBB). This is because it is very well integrated with Moodle, it is free/libre (but with excellent hosting available from the people who created it), and the people who created it are absolutely dedicated to it and do not have corporate masters who might decide to go into some other market on a whim. My main criticism of BBB is they have a habit of still calling versions of their software beta when it is actually ready for use. I would point out how complex and network dependent video conferencing can be but you already know that

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video conferencing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marcus, I'm the product manager for BigBlueButton and manage each of the releases. > My main criticism of BBB is they have a habit of still calling versions of their software beta when it is actually ready for use. Our mantra is we release on quality, not dates.  We also have very high standards for each release, and a development process to ensure quality.  As such, the length of our beta cycle that is usually as long, or if not longer, than the development cycle itself. The result is that the final release tends to be stable and allows us to focus our efforts on the next.  We've had fifteen releases of the product over the past eight years.  Our main use case is thinking about the needs of instructor wanting to teach students effectively. There are some very large deployments of BigBlueButton (and some very large organizations that publicly state they save over $10m USD / year using our product).   For Moodle, the BigBlueButtonBN plugin for Moodle is currently ranked #5 in overall downloads and used by 4,500 sites.  We're closing in on the #4 spot. This widespread adoption reenforces our commitment to stability and usability first, features second.  Looking ahead, we will continue to improve BigBlueButton in each release, to deepen the integration with Moodle, and to focus on the needs of the instructor. Thanks for sharing information on our project.  Much appreciated. Warm regards,.. Fred BigBlueButton Product Manager

ResponsesInList.Title: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Everyone - We just added a new module that allows you to add Adobe Connect Pro meetings to your course, just like any other activity. This was built in conjunction with Adobe by Remote-Learner.net. It can be retrieved from contrib CVS , or from http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=3599 . Feel free to try it out and post issues here or in the tracker. Regards, Mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for this Mike, just what I have been searching for. Some questions that would really help getting this up and running:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Richard, I've posted some documentation on Moodle Docs here . In order to get the activity plug-in to work properly there were some changes I had to make to the configuration files for my Adobe Connect Pro server . The to the config file allowed the activity module to make web service calls and use HTTP header authentication so that the users from Moodle could join the Adobe Connect Pro meetings. I'm pasting some of the notes from the help page to answer your question regarding the settings and what values to use Host - This is the URL where REST calls are sent to and it must bet set to the domain where our ACP server exists. If your ACP server is behind the domain name of myacpserver.com, then this settings would look like myacpserver.com/api/xml. Meeting domain - This value is just the domain name of your ACP server and would be the same as the Host setting above without the /api/xml part. Port - The port your ACP server uses for it's connections. The default port is by no means the recommended port needed for the activity plug-in to work. You may use any value for this so as long as your Adobe Connect Pro server is setup to receive requests from that port. Admin Login - This is the super administrator account user name. This account will be useed to make all the API calls. This account should also have permissions to create users, create meetings and assign permissions to user. If you are not sure which user account that is then you will have to contact your ACP server administrator and consult with them. Admin Password - the password for the super administrator account. Again if you are not sure about this then consult with your ACP server administrator. I would also like to note that I'm currently working on adding a "Test Connection" button to the activity global settings page, so that you can test your connection settings to ensure that all the operations the activity module performs does in fact work with the settings that were provided

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Lila, When adding the activity and entering in the Meeting URL: there is no need to enter the domain name. There is a help bubble that you can use to see how the Meeting URL is used. I'm in the process of updating the code and I hope to have a more informative help bubble and more importantly adding more thorough form validation to prevent situations like this. I'm pasting the latest help bubble text I have that will be in the next update: For example if the Adobe Connect server domain was located at http://adobe.connect.server/ when customizing the URL to mymeeting, the URL to connect to the meeting would be http://adobe.connect.server/mymeeting . Leave out the trailing forward slash Valid URL entries consists of the name with mymeeting /mymeeting Invalid URL entries consist of more than one forward slash: mymeeting/mymeeting mymeeting/mymeeting/ mymeeting/mymeeting//anothermeeting mymeeting/ I would also like to note that I've created some documentation on Moodle Docs for this activity module here Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Based on the error you are receiving it the module is attempting to create a new user (on the Adobe Connect server) with the same username as the logged in user. However a user on the Adobe Connect server already exists. I can suggest a couple of things. 1. If you could download the new source code for the module. Got to Adobe Connect settings from the 'Manage Activities ' page in the Administration block; and test the connection. The test will run through a number or procedures and report back if there was an error in any of them. 2. Double check if the Moodle user you are logged in as already exists on your Adobe Connect server. If so and the Adobe user is NOT an admin, remove the user on the Adobe Connect server and try it again. 3. Alternatively, you could create a new Moodle user that does not currently exist on the Adobe Connect serber and try to create and join a meeting. One question, are you receiving that message when you click on the 'Join meeting' button?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: I think I may have answered my own question. Adobe has online documentation: http://help.adobe.com/en_US/AcrobatConnectPro/7.5/WebServices/WS5b3ccc516d4fbf351e63e3d11a171ddf77-7ff5.html The big difference is whether you have your own ACP server or whether you use a "hosted account" (hosted on an Adobe server). If you have your own server you can use header authentication. However, if you are hosted by Adobe the documentation says: "With a Acrobat Connect Pro hosted account, you cannot use single sign-on or external authentication. You must pass the user’s authentication credentials on the Acrobat Connect Pro hosted account, not the credentials for an external network." So, it looks like this module only works partially with an Adobe-hosted ACP account. You can create the meeting and allow your users to log in as guests, but not log them in as users with Adobe-defined roles. Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, What a great module it is! To use this module, is the admin account of the Adobe Connect Pro required? Also if I don't want to create a new account on Connect Pro, but I want to let student access as a public user, how should I do? Toshimi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Toshimi, Yes the admin Adobe Connect Pro user account credentials is required. Or at the very least an account that has the permissions to make web services calls, create meetings, create users, update meetings and update user roles. Without the user account credentials the activity module will not be able to perform the operations needed to create Adobe Connect Pro meetings and users. Also, I've created some documentation on Moodle Docs regarding the setup of this activity module here Regards to your second question. If you would like to allow users to access the meeting as public users, you can add the activity module and set the Meeting Type setting to "Public". You can then distribute the Meeting URL from the meeting details page to the users who are to join the meeting. Moodle users do not have an account created on the Adobe Connect server until the actually attempt to join the server through the activity module. So using the method I described above would not create additional accounts on the Adobe Connect Pro server. Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: You can get the latest version of the activity module here . When the activity module creates a new user account on the Connect Pro server it does not use the same password that the user has in Moodle (and there is no way it to figure out that password), so it creates a random password. The activity module will automatically log in the user into Connect Pro once they click on "Join Meeting" button. So the user essentially does not need to know their Connect Pro password. When you are creating a meeting in Moodle how long does it take for you? It sounds like you are creating meeting with the activity module, but you are having users go directly to the meeting URL rather than clicking on the "Join Meeting" button. In order for the user to receive the same role, on Connect Pro, that you gave them in Moodle that user must click on the "Join Meeting" button. Only after the user has clicked on that button will the user be assigned their role on Connect Pro. This was a design choice so that the API calls were only made when there was a absolute need to do so.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Then there is a problem if the user wishes to use Adobe Connect Moodle outside of the Moodle side. The design of this authentication will be more complicated if Moodle and Adobe Connect has LDAP authentication, because this module will create two users with different passwords in the database , Adobe Connect, (user_id: user_id and passw_ldap: randompasswd) Why not implement SSO authentication is explained in the Administrator Manual Adobe Connect? So no need to add users to the database Adobe Connect Pro, and they will open the meeting with the password for Moodle in Adobe Connect Pro This scheme would also valid for the Implementation of MOODLE + LDAP + ADOBE CONNECT.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: There I'll post a copy of the Adobe Connect's manual about SSO, it will be necesary to do some changes in the server's config files. Configure HTTP header authentication on Acrobat Connect Pro ... skip configuration because this info are in the manual .... Write the authentication code (This is important) The authentication code must authenticate the user, add a field to the HTTP header that contains the user login, and send a request to Acrobat Connect Pro. Set the value of the header_field_name header field to a Acrobat Connect Pro user login. Send an HTTP request to Acrobat Connect Pro at the following URL: http://connectURL/system/login. The Java filter on Acrobat Connect Pro catches the request, looks for the header_field_name header, then looks for a user with the ID passed in the header. If the user is located, the user is authenticated and a response is sent. Parse the HTTP content of the Acrobat Connect Pro response for the string "OK" to indicate a successful authentication. Parse the Acrobat Connect Pro response for the BREEZESESSION cookie. Redirect the user to the requested URL on Acrobat Connect Pro, and pass the BREEZESESSION cookie as the value of the session parameter, as follows: http://connectURL?session=BREEZESESSION Note: You must pass the BREEZESESSION cookie in any subsequent requests to Acrobat Connect Pro during this client session.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, The activity module already implements the HTTP header authentication for Connect Pro. What I meant to say was that once the a user clicks on the "Join Meeting" button, the user is authenticated against the Connect Pro server using the method above. No password information is passed to the Connect Pro server. Clicking on the "Join Meeting" button is encouraged because such actions can be logged in Moodle and some people may want that. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm wondering if your meetings are set to record. If you're meeting is being recorded then when you join the meeting you should see a red circle in the top right hand corner of the meeting window. Another thing as well is that after you join a meeting. In order to see the recordings for that meeting on the Moodle page, you will have to refresh your browser. During my testing I found that the meeting recordings, on the Connect Pro server, were being stored in the 'Forced Recordings' folder. The module moves meeting recordings, on the Connect Pro server, from the 'Forced Recordings' folder to the 'Shared Content' folder. So you can check to see if there are in fact any meetings by logging in to your Connect Pro server and clicking on 'Content' then 'Shared Content'. That is where the module looks for meeting recordings from meetings that were setup by the module itself.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: The module was developed and tested using a dedicated Connect Pro server. It has not been tested with a hosted account from Adobe. My goal is to fully test with a hosted account and release a new version. Some users have been trying to get the module to work with their hosted accounts. Users with hosted accounts say they can create meetings and assign roles to meetings, however the SSO feature does not work for their hosted accounts. One user pointed to Adobe documentation stating that you cannot externally authenticate users if you are using a hosted account. Your host setting would be "connectpro000000000.emea.acrobat.com/api/xml" and your domain setting would just be "connectpro000000000.emea.acrobat.com" For your port number, because you on a hosted account I would guess 80 would work. The reason why there is a port number to begin with is for when a dedicated server is running on a different port other than 80. Regarding the HTTP Authentication Header, this setting is needed to ensure the SSO functionality works. However because you are on a hosted account, I do not believe this setting will work for you (as mentioned above ). I have provided more details about this module and settings on the MoodleDocs page here

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module

Only thing you need to do is sign in to the meeting room again (no SSI option since it is a hosted account.) The issues I was having was creating a host role for someone with admin system permissions in Moodle. The default role appeared to be Presenter. I decided to create a quick video showing how I create Adobe Connect meetings with the Moodle plugin on our hosted Adobe Connect server: http://www.screencast.com/t/YWMxYWY5Z I hope this helps, as the plugin offers real advantages by creating a calendar event for the meeting in the course, creates automatic links to the meeting for easy access by students, and allows you to create and delete Adobe Connect meetings within Moodle, without having to login to the Adobe Connect server. The only thing you will need to do extra as compared to an internally hosted Adobe Connect account, is to sign in once more to Adobe Connect when you enter the meeting you created in Moodle. I really think this plugin will encourage our instructors to host more meetings, as well as easily being able to create meetings for students to host, too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Barbara, The code addressed an issue that was strictly on the Moodle plug-in side of things. So there is no need to remove your administrator rights on the ACP server. Being an administrator on your ACP hosted server was not an issue. The issue that was fixed was when the user was using the Moodle administrator account to try to create and join meetings. Simply put if the user had the " Allowed to do everything moodle/site:doanything" capability then they would have been affected by this issue. I would say that if it is not too much trouble to update your plug-in with the latest code, then please do. However, getting Moodlerooms to upload the updated version is troublesome then a simple work around to the issue you are having was to simply create a new role that is similar to the Moodle Adminsitrator role except it does not have the 'Allowed to do everything' capability. Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, A hosted account is one where the Connect Pro server is on Adobe's servers. A non-hosted account is one where you (or your admin) is required to install the server onto one of your own servers. Regarding the duplicate meeting name issue. Yes only unique meeting names can be created using the plug-in. This is a restriction that is imposed on the Connect Pro server itself. Also, just to note that the word "meeting" is a reserved word in Connect Pro. So that word cannot be used as a meeting name. Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Petri, First I recommend using a moodle account that does not have the same username/email as the ACP admin account. Just to get some information, when you are assigning roles what context level are you assigning them at? Site, course category, course, module, etc. Also, what happens when you change the meeting from public to private and try it again? Can you replicate the permissions issue for a new user (with teacher role) in Moodle? Meaning if you create a new user, assign the user a teacher roles in Moodle then login as that user and create a meeting and attempt to join. In your ACP log that you posted, were there a call to permissions-info? The permissions-info call check to see what role on the ACP server the user currently has. For your second point, the specification to create meetings in the user's meeting folder wasn't part of the requirements Adobe had when we made the module. Is there a reason why meetings should be created in the user's meeting folder as opposed to the shared folder?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: About the shared/user's are where the meetings could be created, Í think also that the user's own area is better, and i'll explain why: I'm using the same ACP server with many moodle instances, so putting all the meetings together in the shared area, will result in a chaos, instead using different admin users, one for every moodle instance with it's owner area, will result in a controlled chaos in my ACP server . ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Your setup sounds odd. If your user has permissions to add an activity module in the course then they should see the Adobe Connect activity module in the drop down. A user does not need the Moodle Adobe Connect Host role to add an activity instance. Double check and see if your are overriding any permissions, because what you are describing does not seem like the default behaviour. Look at your site roles. The activity module creates 3 roles. Each role has one capability set to 'Allow' by default. Your Adobe Connect Presenter role should only have the ' mod/adobeconnect:meetingpresenter' set to allow. Your Host role should only have the ' mod/adobeconnect:meetinghost' set to allow ; and your Participant role should only have the ' mod/adobeconnect:meetingparticipant' capability set to allow. Can you remove that test user on your ACP server. Turn on developer debugging on your Moodle site. Login in as that test user and click on the connect meeting activity. Does anything display on your screen? Also when you attempt to join can you check the logs on your ACP server? When you click on the 'join meeting' button and the user has not yet been created on the ACP server, you should see the following API calls in your ACP server log: action => principal-list, filter-login => <username> (this checks to see if the user exists) action => principal-update, first-name => <value>, last-name => <value>, login => <value>, password => <value>, extlogin => <value>, type => 'user', send-email => 'false', has-children => 0, email => <value> (this will create the user if none exists) action => permissions-info, acl-id => <value>, filter-principal-id => <value> (this checks to see if the user has a role in the meeting already) Lastly, can you double and ensure that all of the files in the adobeconnect folder have been updated correctly? To answer your last question, the module (with regard to assigning ACP roles) only uses the capabilities that were created by the module itself. Creating/editing the module settings is governed by the same capability that all activity modules use.

Wading through the AC api is not fun.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: !!!*** SOLVED ***!!! Yes, today I was able to use the AC-Moodle Plugin with my Connect v8 server. The Adobe documentation lacks on the new position of web.xml, that now it's under /appserv/web/WEB-INF instead of /appserv/conf/WEB-INF, but the crash responsibility it's mine... I forgot to decomment the filter along the filter-mapping into web.xml, so obviously the server crashed. The upgrade/update of ACv8 it's completely painless but you need to reenable manually the httpheaderauthentication features. And the moodle plugin (for 1.9.x) does not need any change, simply works! Bye.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Lila, If the user's account, on the AC server, is created by the activity module, then they password is randomly generated and unknown to anyone. The user is then logged in via web services to the AC server.  That is the reason why your users are still able to join meetings. Though I should note that a user may still be logged into the AC server even after they have left a meeting.  The AC server will automatically log the user out once their session expires.  The exact time it takes for a session to expire is unknown to me however. The user could technically go tot he main AC URL and possibly change their own password, or go to the forget password page and the activity module should still work without any issues. The alternative is to first create users on your AC server and to make sure the user has the same username or email (sepending on whether you have 'Email address login' checked).  The activity module will look for users with the same username or email address and assume that the currently user exists and log them in. Hope this helps

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Caryn, Just to clairfy are you installing a block?  Or are you installing an activity module (sounds like you are)? Just to note that this forum is only for support of the activity module here . I'm not completely clear on your explaination. When you say 'Assign Roles', there are two areas where this can be done. 1. The main course view has an administration block where you can click Assign Roles.  On this page you will see the Adobe Connect roles listed as well as other Moodle roles.  When you assign roles on this page you are assigning roles only in the context of that course . 2. Viewing the Adobe Connect meeting details (by clicking on the activity) there are two buttons 'Join Meeting' and 'Assign Roles'.  On this page when 'Assign Roles' is clicked, you will see an interface that will only list the Adobe Connect roles.  In addition, this area is where you can assign Adobe Connect roles speficically for the context of that activity .  This means you can Assign adobe connect roles to user but they will only have those roles within that activity, but not outside of the activity. Now which area were you referring to when you say "I can only set roles under 'Assign Roles'"? Regarding the message "Resource does not exist".  Can you double check the 'Test Connection' messages on the settings page and make sure that none of the tests have failed.  Tests that have passed are in green and tests that have failed are in red. If everything has passed turn on DEBUGGING mode for your site.  Try removing that meeting that is giving you the error message and try adding a new meeting and see if any error message appear and if you are able to join the meeting. It may have been the case that an activity module is still showing up in your course when it is in fact partically deleted.  This can sometimes happen when an error occurs in the add/delete process.

ResponsesInList.Title: Hosted mode - transition from version 7.5 to version 8.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, my organization is using Moodle 1.9 with Adobe Connect in hosted mode. The plugin works fine although it cannot sync users so you need them to login to Adobe Connect when they want to enter a meeting. Since European Adobe servers are going to migrate to version 8 next month, we tested the 1.9 version plugin against Adobe Connect. It works fine, apart from the fact that there are a few corrections to be made to the plugin, since links to resources are broken due to the fact that the plugin adds an extra "http://" before every link. I assume that this is due to the fact that Adobe Connect 7.* wasn't prepending resource links with the protocol, but now it does. After correcting this (it is a couple of lines in views.php and one in join.php), everything works fine. If anyone wants the code, just contact me. Furthermore, in our system the Moodle plugin was publishing under the "Meeting Recordings" a list of all resources uploaded in the meeting  (including links to images and PDFs used in the conference, sometimes deleted and duplicate ones), I've made a little change so that it only publishes links to conferences and shows their duration: this way students will only see recordings and will be able to tell which is the real recording of, say, a 50-minute conference, and which is a test recording of 20 seconds.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosted mode - transition from version 7.5 to version 8.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Pavel, It is a known issue, with what I call "hosted" accounts, that the SSO functionality to not work. Adobe does not allow SSO to work for hosted accounts.  I have brought this to the attention of Adobe; but they were unable to give me a timeline for when this can be resolved. ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, PLEASE HELP- kind of urgent, I have lost admin access to my moodle install!  I am running Moodle 1.9.9 and an Adobe Connect Pro hosted monthy account with Adobe.  I carefully studied the forums and installed the Adobe/Remote Learner module- put in settings as noted by Ms. Delamarre's recent posts to accomodate the hosted global settings (using correct host name, domain, port, etc.).  I ran the test on the settings page successfully. Everything looked great- and I busily set about adding a course with an Adobe Connect activity.  After that I tried to see if I added a presenter or host from within Moodle if I could log in to Adobe connect using that same profile from within Moodle.  That did not seem to work. The problems started after I logged out from Moodle and tried to log back in- I soon noticed that I am now unable to log into Moodle.  I tried the 2 admin accounts, and with both- Moodle simply returns me back to the log in home page of Moodle.  It recognizes the user name- but does nothing with the password (does not put up a wrong password error).  I tried several times of having Moodle send a new password via email- which it does.  But the new password will not work either. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosted Mode- problem logging in after install module
ResponsesInList.Text: This could be as simple as salt.   If you have as is default in Moodle 1.9** and M2 used a salt for the passwords, it is extremely important that old salt is put into the new config.php ... There are Moodle docs with cool words on same "password salting". You may well need to follow the salt trail.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: hi Akin and others, In our local branch I've applied a number of tweaks and fixes. If you're using Git it should be trivial to pull them through. If not, you should be ;) Seriously though - I'll file some Tracker items and generate patches to do it the old way. The commit series is at https://github.com/une/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/compare/master...une_master (that une_master branch shows what we have in production; the master branch tracks the CVS upstream changes). The changes are: We set a new logo based on the Connect logo (no more white rectangle) The meeting URL was never being validated. Connect accepts 60 character meeting URLS. The database field was limited to 10 characters but was never being validated - so would either (a) fail on database entry or (b) fail on the Connect side. The commits here extend the field to 60 characters and apply validation. The format of the URLs is validated. It has to start with a letter [a-zA-Z] and contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens. We do a simple replacement of all bad characters with hyphens and validation fails if first character isn't a letter. The meeting times (start and end) both default to now. This means that validation fails if you don't adjust them. The change sets the end time to 2 hours in the future. The title field on the module form is strangely titled in the default English language pack (it's just 'Adobe Connect'). That's tweaked here to 'Meeting title' to match the other fields that are 'Meeting x' If either your meeting title or (when in Groups mode) the name of your group had non url-friendly characters (like ampersands '&') the meeting name was getting chopped off. That's now fixed by properly encoding the xml entities. I think that's it for now ;) Myles C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module and 8.1 Sp1
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't quite understand.  What is a small named host setup?  And how does it differ with Adobe Connect's new policy? Not sure if this helps, but the plug-in give a user an adobe connect role once they click the 'Join meeting' button.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module and 8.1 Sp1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Akinsaya, Well, it doesn't really break it.  Things just work now according to the licensing rules.  So if you didn't have it setup right before it would still work but now it won't. You can license Connect as a 5-user named host setup (or more users). This is in the context of running your own connect server at your site. Previously anyone who was a host in a meeting did not count against the 5-user limit.  This was not enforced by Connect prior to 8.1SP1.  Hosted accounts will eventually have the same enforcement. What that meant was you could have any user in moodle create a room and host it as long as you didn't have more than 5 concurrent rooms running.  Now, someone can create a room but can't host the room until they are placed in the Meeting Hosts group on the connect server.  Until the host arrives the room is not usable by presenters and participants. To your second sentence "Not sure if this helps, but the plug-in give a user an adobe connect role once they click the 'Join meeting' button."  Yes, but even if they are a host in the meeting they will not be able to host the meeting .  They need to be in the "Meeting Hosts" group on the connect server which counts towards your license user limit.  An administrator needs to grant access to being a host -- people can't just create a room on their own and use it without being granted host access inside connect. Again, hosted installations of connect don't have this enforcement yet but it is coming. -- Scott

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: I got it working (to a point) by using the following values: Host I put the adobe connect url supplied with the trial account: Like: meet#######.adobeconnect.com followed by /api/xml Meeting domain I put the adobe connect url supplied with the trial account: Like: meet#######.adobeconnect.com Port I left this at 80 Admin Login I put the email address I use to log in to the trial account Admin Password I use the password for above Email address login This must be checked (I found out the hard way) or it won't work. The rest I Left as default. This enables the Test Connection to work One big point I learned is that the meetings setup in MOodle are under "Shared Meetings" IN AdobeConnect.com There you have to setup the host and/or presenter roles otherwise even though you create the meeting in Moodle you will be logged in as a participant. In other words as explained elsewhere in this thread the roles assigned in Moodle do not carry over when you are using adobe hosted service.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to access to a recording meeting. IMPOSSIBLE!
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ata, How to apply a patch depends on how you have your Moodle instance set up. Is it hosted on Windows/Linux? Are you using any version control? Do you have a test environment where you can test applying the patch & make sure it works for you before applying it to your live environment? If not, I HIGHLY recommend you set one up before applying any contributed patches! As Akin mentioned, modifying your code can make future updates difficult. See Davo's comment here (which also includes a link to the docs on applying a patch): http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=164818#p722393 In the meantime, I would suggest that you go to http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-3302 and "vote" for the issue (you will need to create an account if you don't already have one). This way hopefully the patch will be reviewed by the maintainer (Akin) and might make it into the next version of the module. If that happens, you will be able to simply download the new version of the module.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to access to a recording meeting. IMPOSSIBLE!

Is there any rapid solution ir order to get solved that issue? Modifing or comment some php code lines? Thanks again

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to access to a recording meeting. IMPOSSIBLE!
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ata, You can apply a patch on the local copy of the files on your machine using the tutorial: http://docs.moodle.org/dev/How_to_apply_a_patch You can take a look at the relevant commit in a Github repository branch (e.g. https://github.com/jamedmondson/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/commit/6d5f6f899dadd468d39d06b91b0a30faede41d4c ) and see what changes were made (deletions in red & additions in green). You can then apply these manually. There is also a link to "view file" where you can access the new version of a file, but BEWARE as the changes may have been made to a different version of the file, so by copying the whole file, you may write over any other changes that had been made on your original copy. If you're still keen to make manual changes, you could try making the following key changes ( WARNING : not a recommended method - see previous posts) : 1. Make a backup of your current joinrecording.php file and make sure that there is minimal activity on your live site. 2. Add the third line (in green) to line 19 (in my copy) of joinrecording.php: $id          = required_param('id', PARAM_INT); $groupid     = required_param('groupid', PARAM_INT); $recordingid = required_param('recording', PARAM_INT); 3. Make the following change (in green) to line 105/106 (in my copy) of joinrecording.php: redirect($protocol . $CFG->adobeconnect_meethost . $port . $recording [$recordingid] ->url . '?session=' . $adobesession); 4. Upload the new joinrecording.php file to your site using FileZilla and be prepared to restore your backup copy if anything goes wrong! 5. Report back here Jen p.s. I signed up for a free trial of an adobe.com hosted account and tested out the two-line change above. It seemed to work for me: p.p.s. This is the bare minimum required to get the recording URL to work. You will have to make further changes to view.php (as per the github link) if you want recording support for Adobe Connect activities created in 'group mode' (multiple meetings per activity)). p.p.p.s. have you considered downloading a local version of Moodle on your computer as a basic test environment? http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=177330 Careful - it's addictive!

ResponsesInList.Text: So you are saying that your Adobe Connect Pro account is hosted by Adobe, and that the Adobe Connect plug-in with single sign-on works for you? The "test connection" passes? Is this with a new version of the Adobe Connect plug-in?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: For me, the plug-in (same version - 2011072120) worked fine with the hosted server in terms of test connection, setting up activities, transferring appropriate roles, and displaying recordings. The SSO didn't work - clicking on "Join meeting" or on a recording URL still required the user to log in to the hosted AC system.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the heads-up, Jennifer.  I haven't gotten as far as to actually try to join a meeting.  I only tested the connection and created a test meeting and noticed that all of my templates, etc., were there and things looked good to that point.  I saw in the Moodle Docs that SSO didn't work with hosted, so that doesn't surprise me. As it stands, we have a hidden field in Moodle that holds their Connect password, so as long as they don't change it from the Connect site, we have Moodle pass that along and log them in automatically to join the sessions.  I may need to hold onto some variation of that, it sounds.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Wait: so the plugin *doesn't* work with Adobe Connect Pro hosted by Adobe? I am getting mixed signals here. Does the plugin work, or not? If single sign-on doesn't work, then the plug-in doesn't work (what good would it be without that?). But if it does work, then single sign-on works. So... which is it? (I was never able to get it to work, but I would love to discover that I made some configuration error and that it does work, after all.) P.S. If it seems that I am frustrated, I apologize. I mean no disrespect. But I tried for over a week to get this plug-in working, and it never did. Contrast this with the WizIQ plug-in, which took about ten minutes to get installed and working.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to clarify, SSO does not work with an Adobe connect hosted solution.  Adobe it aware of this and specifically stated that they are aware of this issue and it is not a priority for them.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: However, by the sound of it Brandon came up with a work around.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: I got the chance to further test the plug-in and it does seem like it's about 90% there for our case.  It does, indeed, create and manage the sessions perfectly from within Moodle.  The one stumbling block is the SSO issue.  I'm guessing it's related to this one comment in the Docs: "After the installation of the server, Enable HTTP header authentication."  I might try to email Adobe and ask whether or not this is something we can request of our hosted server, but I'm not going to hold my breath. So, it seems at least for now, I'm going to have to continue our current method.  I'm able to launch/authenticate successfully straight into a Connect session from within Moodle using a hidden field, but the key to that is the student cannot change their Connect password.  In our case, this has not been an issue, since we never send them directly to Connect and, from the student view of things, it's all one big solution and they don't notice they're being redirected. I was just hoping I could do all of the management from within Moodle, but it seems that's still out of our grasp.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Brandon, I understand your frustration. I too am using an Adobe hosted solution and it took me about an hour to figure out the correct configuration settings. I now have it working so I thought I would share them with you. Note - Port 80 did not work for me because our account requires SSL connection so I changed to port 443 and the error messages stopped. You can tell if SSL is required by looking under the Advanced Features heading on the Adobe Connect Account Summary page for admin accounts. I looked all over for information on how to edit the HTTP Authentication Header but I could not figure out a way to edit the information from a hosted solution account. Our organization does not need single sign-on because our students normally login as guests to any Adobe webinars that we host. That's our pre-Moodle process anyway and I don't see it changing any time soon. Since that's how it is now when we send links to our meetings, I don't see what the big burden is. Now that we have Moodle, the student clicks on the Adobe Connect activity link, clicks on the Join Meeting button and a pop-up window open asking them to login with either username/password or as a guest. I am choosing to use the plugin for the ability to automatically have the activity show up on the calendar as described in Barbara Schroeder's video posted in this thread June 5, 2010 . Otherwise, I would probably follow Brian Rutherford's advice in his post in this thread on June 4, 2010 . PS - I'm using a hosted Adobe account (ACP version 8.2.2.0) with a hosted Moodle account running Moodle 2.2.4+ (Build: 20120712) and Adobe Connect Pro Module (version = 2011072120).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text:
With ACP 9.0.4 Adobe introduced the Enhanced Security feature wich is on by default ( http://blogs.adobe.com/connectsupport/using-the-xml-api-with-enhanced-security/ ). For the Plugin to work you need to disable this feature. This works at the moment. According to Adobe they will enforce this in the future: " Make sure to update such integrations with session identifier after
logging in and use secured Web Services APIs so that the integrations
keep working after this option is removed in the near future and
enhanced security is enabled by default." So I guess the plugin will have to be updated to be able to use the secured Web Services APIs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luis, It sounds like it's failing when it tries to assign the creator of the activity to the Adobe Connect Host role ( https://github.com/number33/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/blob/MOODLE_20_STABLE/lib.php#L89 ) The fact that the roleid is empty ( https://github.com/number33/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/blob/MOODLE_20_STABLE/lib.php#L87 ) suggests that it is not finding one of the roles that is automatically set up as part of the install ( https://github.com/number33/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/blob/MOODLE_20_STABLE/lib.php#L86 ). Could you please confirm that when you go to "Site Administration -> Users -> Permissions -> Define roles" that you can see a role with "adobeconnecthost" as a short name? Another way to check if this is the root cause of the issue is to set the permission for the ' mod/adobeconnect:meetinghost ' capability to "Allow" for a role such as the manager (either in the system context or in the course context by locally overriding the role), and then try creating an activity when logged in as a user with the manager role in the course.

If any of the tests below have failed, this activity module will not function properly. For further assistance and documentation in how to set up your Adobe Connect Pro server please consult the MoodleDocs help page for this activity module Help page Sending common-info call: successfully obtained the session key: em1breeznhxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx logging in as xxxxxx@XXXX.pt was not successful, check to see if the username and password are correct" I substituted here the actual the session key and email with x's. I checked the email and the password and they are absolutely correct. I don't know what is the problem now. Can you please help me? I'm driving myself nuts... Many thanks Jennifer, Luís

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luís, There are two parts to this A. Module installation ( https://github.com/number33/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/blob/MOODLE_20_STABLE/db/install.php ) It sounds like the module did not install correctly. Given where it stopped (after the creation of the adobeconnectpresenter role), it sounds like it failed when it tried to set up which standard Moodle roles can assign which Adobe Connect roles. It expected to find the roles with each of the following shortnames: coursecreator, editingteacher, teacher. It's important to have the the module install correctly so that it can set up the three roles correctly. If you are missing one (or all) of the above roles, you could do one of the following: 1. (Temporarily) create the missing roles (coursecreator, editingteacher, teacher), and then re-install the module. 2. Or apply the following patch which will stop the installation from failing if it can't find the aforementioned roles: https://github.com/jamedmondson/moodle-mod_adobeconnect/commit/997b0b52cc680f93c9e8cb9369cfc3bcc4b90cc5 , and then re-install the module. 3. Or manually set up the roles: Role / shortname / set-up Adobe Connect Host / adobeconnecthost / Set "mod/adobeconnect:meetinghost" to "Allow" (everything else "Not Set") Adobe Connect Presenter / adobeconnectpresenter / Set "mod/adobeconnect:meetingpresenter" to "Allow" (everything else "Not Set") Adobe Connect Participant / adobeconnectparticipant /  Set "mod/adobeconnect:meetingparticipant" to "Allow" (everything else "Not Set") Then you would need to set up some of your core roles to be able to assign the newly created roles (the installer sets it up so that editingteacher, teacher, and manager can assign all three of the new Adobe Connect roles. I would suggest adding manager to that list.) B. Password If you can log into Adobe Connect directly with your supplied username and password, but not via the module, there could be a problem with the username or password not being escaped correctly. To test this theory, you could try temporarily changing the password to something simple (8 characters, with only upper, lower and numeric characters, avoiding letters with accents) and see if that works.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: I was able to get the plugin to connect to my Connect 9 server. I had the wrong external name under host mappings on the Connect Server. Once I fixed this the connection tests worked. This just left Header Authentication I had to make changes to the web.xml file and the custom.ini file. In the custom.ini I added the line HTTP_AUTH_HEADER=header_field_name (as per Migrating, Installing, and Configuring ADOBE CONNECT 9 Document) For the web.xml file (\appserv\web\WEB-INF\) I commented out the all init-param elements with a param-name of ignore-pattern- x : and added <filter-mapping> <filter-name>HeaderAuthenticationFilter</filter-name> <url-pattern> /api/* </url-pattern> </filter-mapping> (as per the Connect 9 Web Services Document) I still have to test the recordings but I just wanted to post my progress in case it may be of help to someone.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for posting your solution Shaun. Regarding the wrong external name under host mappings, was this setting in your Connect server or was there something you had to do differently when you were configuring the plug-in? Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Its a setting in the connect server that can only be access when logged in locally to the server and using the console. When running in a single server mode in needs to match the FQDN. I only had the server name. I'm guessing most would have a fully operational connect server running before they tried the plugin so I don't think many will come across this. I'm working mostly it a testing environment as we are in the process of switching from elluminate to connect. My connect server worked internally but not externally till I fixed this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Taking a look at the latest release of the AC Module, i found a potential bug that i solved in the earlier releases: if room name or users name has accented chars in it, the xml format it's invalid and the module throw an error. I solved this substituting all the htmlentities occurrence with htmlspecialchars, as in Italian  most of the days names ends with an accented char (Lunedì, Martedì ... and so on), and many lastnames contains accented chars in it. Adobe connect supports these chars, but the module not. Hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Akinsaya, Adobe is the name of the company that sells products like Acrobat, Connect, Photoshop, etc. Adobe Acrobat is a product that creates PDF files. The Pro version enables you to edit the files as well. Adobe Connect is a product that enables you to host web conferences, webinars and online meetings. There is a free version which has many limitations and a paid "Pro" (Professional) version that includes added features and the ability to host more people at the same time. I suspect that the reference to Acrobat above was simply a typo as Acrobat has nothing to do with web conferencing. Best regards, Michael Milette

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Editing the activity title from the course view page changes only the name of the activity in the database, and does not change the meeting name on the server. This can lead to inconsistencies between the meeting name and the activity name (screenshot attached), as well as unexpectedly changing the meeting name when you edit the activity settings. Is there any way to disable the activity renaming from the course view only for the adobe connect plugin? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Dom Royko, There is no specific capability for the plug-in.  However the moodle/course:manageactivities capability governs whether those user actions such as: edit title, edit activity, move left, move right, etc. But there is no capability that specifically deals with the ability to edit the activity title from the course view. I haven't tested this out myself, but if you wanted to you could prevent that capability in the module context.  As the Moodle code displaying those actions (course_get_cm_edit_actions()) checks to see if the user has the capability in the module context. Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Akinsaya, Thank you for the suggestion. Unless I misunderstand, I do not think this would work for my case. I would need to allow editing for the AC module in the module context, but not allow it in the course context. And in the course context, I would need to disallow editing only for the AC activity, leaving all other activities/resources editable. My idea of turning off editing on the course view page is an imperfect solution anyway. The ideal would be to have consistency between what happens when the meeting name is edited within the activity (including the verification of duplicate names on the server), and what happens with a simple edit on the course view.  However it appears that one is handled by the module, and one by Moodle core. Perhaps it would be better to have the Moodle activity name and the AC meeting name be two different entities, rather than having one entity that is stored in two different places, thereby risking ambiguity? Cheers, Dominik.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: There are two problems 1) The module is not listening for the mod_updated event 2) The mod_updated event is not triggered when you update a module title via the course view.  I've created a tracker for this issue MDL-43207

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text:
A temporary workaround while a more permanent solution is found can be achieved with the following css : 
```text
li.adobeconnect a.editing_title {display: none;}
```
 This will hide the 'pencil' icon ('Edit title') on the course page next to all Adobe Connect activities, forcing the user to use the  'cog' icon ('Update') to rename the Adobe Connect activity. [Hack adapted from https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=204488 & https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-3563 ]

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adobe Connect Pro Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Update of an Adobe Connect  Server "on-premise" to 9.0.4 :  a tale that had an happy ending. Last thursday, i upgraded my AC Server to get it updated to the latest release, because in the following weeks an important update is announced about a chrome compatibility. Following all the instructions, the server was updated successfully, but moodle? Good news, the button "Test Connection" told me that all was green, and i thought: "i can clean up all and i can go  home", but... After some minutes, my phone rang: "we cannot enter anymore in our moodle-connect rooms !!!" PANIC! What happens ? The plugin seems to work, but the join-auto-login does not work. Now the happy ending: after 3days of googling/debugging i've discovered that the upgrade has resetted the web.xml configuration file without changing the file-time (!) and without telling me anything about this overwrite. I put again the web.xml as instructed in the moodle-plugin pages, all the things are now fine again. Hope this can help someone that will do the same upgrade. And BTW, thanks for this plugin!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to make BigBlueButton work on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi King, There may be a conceptual problem here. RecordingsBN is actually a view for the recordings created by BigBlueButtonBN and not a plugin for creating recordings itself. What you need to do is. 1. Add a BigBlueButtonBN activity/room to your course (which you already did) 2. Make sure the option "session can be recorded" is enabled for that activity/room. You'll find that option as an advanced setting by clicking the "show more" below "send notification". If you didn't change anything to the global configuration, this option comes enabled by default. 3. Save the activity/room, use the link that is shown in your course and join the session. 4. Once you are in BBB, make sure to press the button for recording that shows up in the tool bar. The capture will start at that point. 5. Logout from the session and once you are in Moodle again you may want to press the "End session" button. It is not required but it will speed things up for you as the recording is being processed until the session is closed in BBB. If any user remains in the session it is kept open. 6. Wait until the recording is processed, depending of the BBB server, the duration of the session, the resources you used it may normally take something between 6 to 30 minutes. (some times more if you are using test-install. This server is heavily used) 7. After that time, just refresh the page where you activity/room is. The recording should show up there. Now on recordingsBN, well, once the recording is visible in BigBlueButtonBN you should be able to see it in the RecordingsBN list. As I said, the former is the source, the last is just a view. Although, in the Activity/Room you will see only the recordings for that specific instance of BigBlueButtonBN, while in RecordingsBN you will see the recordings for all the activities in that course. I hope this helps. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to make BigBlueButton work on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Humm, Everything looks fine to me, but that depends of what you are expecting to see. ResponsesInList.Title: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all, We are running a Moodle site with 10 000+ users and a virtual classroom installation with up to 500 simultaneous users. We are looking for an alternative virtual classroom that can support this number of simultaneous users (divided over a dozen concurrent  sessions or more). We have been looking at BBB now and again and recently it has started to include the functionality we need (recording, breakout rooms, etc.), so now I wonder if there are any users of BBB out there who have installations of similar or bigger size, so that I can ask them about the hardware infrastructure we would require to set up a server that is sufficiently powerful for our needs. I also have a number of questions about possible functionality (to which I have not yet been able to find the answers on-line): Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? Thanks in advance for any information you can share. Rgrds, Paul.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul, Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Yes, it can serve multiple Moodle sites, servers an even other systems (like Wordpress) with no problem. Each session will have its own meetinID therefore users will join the meetings they have access to. Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? The Moodle integration only allows access through Moodle activities , and only to authenticated users will be able to join. For allowing access through a shared link you would need to tailor an special link. The plugin does not provide that capability. Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? The number of 5 rooms is fixed and it was defined that way to simplify the UI JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jesus, Thanks for your swift replies. Rgrds, Paul.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button: recordingsbn -list of recordings not visible
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary, Now here For the records, and in case someone else experience this issue. Since version 1.1, recordingsBN renders the list of recordings using a javascript YUI library that may not work in some cases we haven identified yet. There is however an option for rendering the page in plain html, in that case and as the recordingsBN resource is already created, an administrator needs first to enable the edition of this feature. Once enabled, go and edit the resource that was added to the course by ticking the option "Show the table in plain html"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button: recordingsbn -list of recordings not visible

ResponsesInList.Title: limiting number of students [BBB]
ResponsesInList.Text: how can i limit the learners that join the virtual classroom to 15 out of 500 with moodle using bigbluebutton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: limiting number of students [BBB]
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mohamed, Since version 2.0 BigBlueButtonBN has an option for setting the userlimit per session. That can be configured globally or per session. You need to be administrator and set the limit using the admin UI for this plugin. Now, if what you want to do is to segregate 15 particular students from 500 enrolled, you may want to group them using Moodle groups in that course. When using the BigBlueButtonBN activity each student will join the room that corresponds to the group s/he is enrolled. I hope this helps. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Latest updates to BigBlueButton and the BigBlueButtonBN plugin for Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Everyone, We'd like to share an update on our progress with BigBlueButton, an open source web conferencing system, and its integration with Moodle. Latest Release Our goal with BigBlueButton is to provide remote students a high-quality online learning experience.  We've been working on it for over seven years and the Moodle integration is (by far) our deepest integration of any LMS. BigBlueButton enables real-time sharing of audio, video, slides, chat, polling, emote icons, and desktop.  Classes can be recorded for later playback for students. The latest release (BigBlueButton 1.0) adds Polling Auto reconnect Improved video dock This release marks our 15th release of BigBlueButton (we called it 1.0 because we are conservative ).  Here's a screen shot showing the default layout. BigBlueButton supports many types of collaboration (one-to-one, small group collaboration, and one-to-many).  Here's a screen shot of a session sharing 15 webcams. For more information on the latest release, see http://bigbluebutton.org/2016/05/17/bigbluebutton-1-0-released/ .  To setup BigBlueButton yourself (it's open source!), see http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/ .  For an overview of using BigBlueButton, see http://bigbluebutton.org/videos/ . Latest release of BigBlueButtonBN plugin for Moodle We've recently released BigBlueButtonBN 2.1.1, the BigBlueButton plugin for Moodle, which has the ability to copy recording links from previous courses.  Here are some screen shots of the integration In addition to offering many options for customization, the BigBlueButtonBN plugin gives teachers and students can access recordings from a BigBlueButton session within Moodle. The BigBlueButtonBN integration for Moodle is available from moodle.org, see https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_bigbluebuttonbn .  According to moodle.org there are  currently 3,869 sites using BigBlueButtonBN. We're very pleased to see this adoption around the world (it's localized into over 25 languages). If you want to quickly try the latest version of BigBlueButton, check out Moodle Cloud which has BigBlueButton built-in (up to 6 users and no recordings).  See: https://moodle.com/2015/07/06/moodle-launches-moodlecloud-free-hosting-for-educators /. As always, we welcome your feedback on BigBlueButton and the BigBlueButtonBN integration for Moodle. Regards,... Fred BigBlueButton Product Manager

ResponsesInList.Title: [BBB] RecordingsBN uses internal IP address instead of domain
ResponsesInList.Text:
For some reason, RecordingsBN uses a playback presentation link with my internal IP address from Amazon AWS EC2 instead of the external IP or domain . An entry of a recording looks like this: 
```text
http://172.x.x.x
/playback/presentation/0.9.0/playback.html?meetingId=xxxxx-xxx
```
 instead of 
```text
https://bbb.mydomain.com/
...
```
 AFAICS, the only occurence of my internal IP address in the bbb configuration is /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts/bigbluebutton.yml : 
```text
playback_host: 172.x.x.x


playback_protocol: https
```
 Should this point to my domain, external IP or internal IP? Maybe someone can point me in the right direction to find the cause of this. bbb-record --check also does not output anything. Versions: RecordingsBN: 1.3.0-beta BBB: 1.0 Moodle: 3.0

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [BBB] RecordingsBN uses internal IP address instead of domain
ResponsesInList.Text: RecordingsBN uses a playback presentation as it is/was received from BBB. So, what you need to fix is either the endpoint on BBB or the recordings already processed. If you haven done it yet, execute this command sudo bbb-conf --setip bbb.yourdomain.com You'll need to restart the server , but once fixed the new recordings will have the new endpoint. Now, for fixing the recordings already processed, you need to reprocess them. sudo bbb-record --rebuild <recordID> You can find more information in the BBB documentation http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/recording.html#process and more help with BBB in BBB forums. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-users

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: icons for Hide and Delete do nothing

What BigBlueButton server are you using? test-install? your own? a hosted server? Depending of the BBB server you are using the actions over recordings can take a few seconds to be processed (up to 10), but you should see a spinning wheel while the request is processed. 3. If you clean caches both in Moodle and your browser, do you still see the problem? 4. If you activate the developer console in your browser (Chrome or Firefox F12) do you see any error message coming? 5. Can you confirm out of moodle if the actions on recordings can be performed? Or, what about in BigBlueButtonBN, can you perform actions to the recordings there? JF

Depending of the BBB server you are using the actions over recordings can take a few seconds to be processed (up to 10), but you should see a spinning wheel while the request is processed. 3. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB recording sessions does not work
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marilena, Yes you are on the right track, but. Lets assume for the moment that your BBB server is correctly installed. Again, don't change anything. Use only the parameters by default. It should work fine. Now, 7) Use the activity, join the session, start the recording, spend some seconds or minutes in the session and end it from the Moodle tab by pressing the end session button. Wait for a few minutes (15 minutes if needed) and then go back to the activity. Is there something showing up at the bottom of the page, right after the description of the bigbluebuttonbn activity?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create BBB-Activity does not work
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a rare situation. I exchanged the IP addresses of both servers in the past. When changing them the virtual network adapter eth0:0 with its original IP address was set on the server with the moodle-instance. Thats why the moodle-instance didn’t forward the request to the BBB-server but to its own webserver.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create BBB-Activity does not work
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rudolf, I am glad you solved your problem. Error code: general_error_unable_connect Generally speaking means that your Moodle server was not able to communicate with your BigBlueButton server. That can be a firewall issue, a DNS issue, routing issue, etc. Just in case anyone else faces this problem, the best way to test it is to execute in your console: curl http://your-bbb-server/bigbluebutton/api The response should be an XML file, the same you get if you use that URL in the browser. If that doesn't work you can confirm that the connectivity issue is there and more likely you'll get a message error telling you where exactly the problem is. Regards, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create BBB-Activity does not work

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issues while using BigBlueButton 2.0.1 plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Yeah, I just noticed. That was a horrible mistake. There was a problem with a warning message appearing when the preuploaded presentation was disabled and a new activity was added, but the"fix" introduced a new bug. The only critical update in 2.0.3 is the last one in the list: https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/BigBlueButtonBN#2.0.3_.282015080610.29 Fixed Bug: When for security reasons either the webserver or the proxy ahead of the webserver(s) adds the header x-content-type-options: nosniff to force the MIME Type verification, the javascript in the client doesn't work on Chrome/ IE . If that is not your case, you can stay with 2.0.2. Or you can download the newest code from the development branch from github. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Why keep showing 'This conference has not yet started.'?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christine, You may have the option "Wait for moderator" enabled for that activity. Wait for moderator When that option is enabled the student won't see the join button appear until the teacher (moderator) is in the session. The message used on that page is misleading. I'll make sure that is changed for the next release. One more thing to keep in mind is that even after the moderator joins the session, the student needs to refresh the page in order to see the new message and join button to appear. I hope this helps. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Why keep showing 'This conference has not yet started.'?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, that is probably what it is.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton and Latex editor - can we marry them?
